text: spotted them next to my auto parts store and I was famished. Ordered a meatball sub togo and it was great. homemade meatballs, nice marinara, plenty of cheese and nice crispy italian roll. put me in a good mood and made installing my alternator  much easier.

We love this place.  We just moved to Henderson and  was looking for a local place.  We hit the jackpot here.  Their wings are incredible and pizza is awesome.  Weds. Night is half price pizza night.  We try to go every weds.
Excellent pizza and double baked wings! Wish they would open a second location near downtown Las Vegas or towards summerlin
Awesome wings, good pizza, good enough service...nice overall neighborhood pub...

A friend and I use to go to the place all the time in HS. We use to buy coupon booklets from the Foothill HS Wrestlers. They always had a JM coupon in it... Brings back good memories..   Few months ago I had family in town and thought this would be a good place to go. WRONG. They forgot to write down my 15 ppl reservation.. We had to wait forever to be seated and then another forever for our food.  My dad loves the place and wanted to go there for his birthday.. Guess what, THEY GAVE OUR RESERVATION AWAY!! We weren't late.. Another big party (that they forgot to write down their reservation for) just so happened to show up before us. So they gave them our reservation! We had to wait for over an hour AGAIN! Then of course our food took awhile to get to us. I know we had a big group but it was a LONG time. Luckily our server (female) was great and very nice. She remembered my dad from last time (I thought that was cool).  The food here is ok. Ranch is good. Fried zucchini & sauce ROCKS. Pizza OK. Family loves the watermelon & suicide sauce for the wings.  Also, the place is too dark.

This is the "Cheers" of Henderson!  Always good food and friendly service.  Their wings and pizza are the absolute best.  Can get a little busy on game nights/days, but it just adds to the ambiance.  You can usually find Johnny filling in here and there, making sure everybody is taken care of.  Even if he is from New York, he's a great guy (LOL)  Love the food, love the atmosphere, bring your friends!
I love the wings. But...$20.00 for two people, really! The service is SLOW.
Best pizza and wings in Henderson! Try the wings double baked! I love this place! The staff are very friendly as well!
Great place for food and drink. Been there many years and your treated very well by everyone. Love going there

Being from buffalo ny my husband and I were so excited to discover johnnie macs. The food is so much like home. If you've never had an authentic beef on wick then this is the place to try one. The staff is so friendly and it's great to find a neighborhood spot with great " back east" food.

Food is great but there's a miscommunication with the staff and the kitchen . I asked for a water and the server asked another server to get it then We order our food at 6:45 didn't get our food u till 8:10 we kept getting excuses as to why our food was so late . I believe the server forgot to put in our order . But she came and blamed it on the kitchen . Either way it took way to long for our pizza and shrimp pasta . Unless they went fishing for shrimp and hand made the pasta there's not a reason to take that long. Thankfully they comped our meal . We did appreciate that . Could be a great place to dine if it had better service .

Had craving for pizza, and I'm new to Henderson so I asked where to go by some local and Yelp. They all told me Johnny Mac's. The place is located in a strip mall next to a Smith Market.  The place has great atmosphere and really good Bar. If you like beer, sports, and video poker then Johnny is the place for you. They advertise NYC pizza, not true. Pizza was Ok, had the special.  Little over priced and doughy but ok. Haven't tried the many other dishes, but all the people where in there where really enjoying themselves. If you want NYC pizza, then Johnnys not your place, but if you as Cheer type place to go. Then Johnny your place

Awesome bar outside of the madness of the strip,   The pizzas are amazing as well as the burger selection,    Big doors open the restaurant up to a nice outside breezy setting.    The servers and bartenders are all friendly,  these are reasons why I'm in there once a week,

Visiting Vegas and very happy to report we had a delicious dinner here at Johnny Mac's. My husband loved the Spaghetti and Meatballs, and our friendly waitress, Tricia, kindly pointed out that it was two-for-one night on his order, so for just a dollar more, he received a second full order to take home for tomorrow. Woohoo! My order was more complicated: I'm allergic to wheat, so no pasta for me. I ordered the California burger, no bun, and asked if the chef could put chopped garlic on my French fries because I can't eat garlic bread. No problem at all, Tricia told us. And extra veggies with my burger, some ranch dressing on the side? Yes, indeed. Our meals were served hot and quickly, and that's the best beef burger I've had in forever! My fries were perfect! I asked Tricia to please let the chef know how happy I was with my dinner and the extra trouble they went to for me. These folks are the best! They really want you to enjoy your dinner. Thanks everyone at Johnny Mac's!

Great Place!  We were a large group of 28 in town for a soccer tournament.  This outstanding place accommodated us on a busy Sunday afternoon full of football games.  Despite the crowds the service was outstanding and the food fantastic!  We couldn't thank you more!   Thanks from San Angelo Extreme FC from Texas!!

Service is awful. Servers have no rhythm and its ridiculous having 5 people ask you if you want something. Food is excellent!   Tea is horrible. Soft drinks are flat. Water tastes like toilet water.   Salad is excellent. Fingers excellent. Ravioli excellent. Philly and club excellent.  Great atmosphere. Love the doors rolled up to get fresh air. No smoking even better!!!

Amazing service. Our son graduated last night and a couple days ago I had gone up and asked if they could accommodate a group of about 15 and if they could put up some decorations we brought. They said sure but customer service being what it is now a days I wasn't sure... we got there last night and not only the table was decorated, they added to them !! Apparently ours had gotten wet so they went to the store and bought more !!! The service and food was phenomenal! Thank you for making our last baby's graduation night special ! You rock!
Stopped by here on the way to Vegas to eat once and I could say the food is great, service is good and bar is enough to get drunk ))

My first time going to Johnny Mac's was when I was a little dweeb of a teenager ditching school to get pizza and wings with my friends. Now, 11 years later I still go to this spot to get pizza and wings only now, I bring my own little humans along. The service has been hit or miss over the years, but hey, ya can't win em all! I love the atmosphere and food here enough to put up with the endless Broncos and Dallas fans haha. All in all, this will always be a favorite go-to for a beer and bite. It's such a well known Henderson spot that you'll even find an officer or two in the building stopping in for lunch. We love our boys in blue!

If I could give this place zero stars I would. The pizza is so absolutely disgusting I couldn't even finish a slice. I would have been better off going to Costco or going across the street so sunset pizza. The wings were dry and so tiny. We asked for blue cheese but it tasted more like sour ranch dressing. Overall it was a huge disappointment. I love supporting local companies but some just aren't worth it.

Awesome food and staff.  We ate here during a baseball tournament and brought the whole team.  They accommodated the whole team and parents.  Pizza and wings combo was a hit.  Cheap beers and multiple TVs for sports watching.  Thank you for a great time.  Trisha was our server and was very curtious.

Finally after 3 years in Las Vegas, I have found the perfect beef on weck!  Excellent! This was our first time at Johnny Macs, and I couldn't have been more pleased. Sandwich was incredible, wings were great, and our server Katie couldn't be more helpful! Prices are a bit on the expensive side (I think), but well worth the great food, and customer service. Anyone in the metro Las Vegas area looking for beef on weck, I strongly recommend Johnny Macs!  Heads up, I believe this sandwich is only available on Fridays, Saturday, and I'm not sure about Sunday. Kudos to our server Katie! Thank you so much!
You've got to try the watermelon BBQ sauce on something. I had it on the wings and wish there was room for the ribs. Sounds weird at first but the watermelon isn't over powering or too sweet.

Food is good wait staff is great !! The bartenders work their a s s off! As a bartender myself I noticed  there was no mats on the hard tile floor!! This is against osha I believe .. I will be calling Johnny himself to complain.., You make a ton of money on the backs of your great staff and you can afford mats!

I fluctuated between 3 stars and 4 stars because I think they're a 3.5 if you take into account 3 means "A-OK" and 4 means "Yay! I'm a fan!"  So consider me a 3.5 which would be, "The food was good with a lot of potential to be great and I really WANT to be a fan."  The review stats are interesting & always help put a perspective on things. For instance on Johnny Mac's, 2/3rds of the reviews are 4-5 star. 1/3 of all reviews are 3 stars and under. So that basically means 1/3 of all reviewers were not happy with their experience in some way, but the majority were. Also of the total amount of their reviews, 1/3 are by Henderson locals. The graphed trend for 2011 is going down. Of the 5 reviews for 2011 thus far, 50% are 3 stars or less & complain about service. Not sure why this trend is happening there. So enough about number crunching their stats, how about the nitty gritty of my own review?  So how did I arrive at a 3.5? Details below. ---------------------------------------  Our table ordered a Jalapeno Cheeseburger w/fries for $8.95 and the 2  slices of pepperoni(or cheese) with a soda for $5.99.   The main points are this:  1) The food runs from good to outstanding depending on what you order.  2) The service is spotty  What this means is you'll have to know what to order in order to have a fantastic meal, and you'll have to forgive the spotty service. Think of it as offering BAR service, NOT restaurant service. Just flag down a server whenever you need something, because are always busy. Do not expect automatic drink refills, asking if you need anything, if you want dessert  or to have your plate removed after you are done. If you get it, great! If not, remember 30 percent of all their reviews talk about the food and/or spotty service. So just don't be surprised when it happens to you. There is a good chance it will. Just learn what to order and lower your dine-in service standards.  The spotty service does irritate me but depending on mood I'll still eat here. How I adjust for it, is in the tip. I tipped 15% this last time but wanted to tip 10% because my server literally did the bare minimum. I didn't but should have. I just always feel weird tipping only 10% but if it happens again I will.   We entered and stood for a few minutes because the servers were busy. We offered to seat ourselves at a high table instead of standing around. No big deal, it's a casual place. After about 5 minutes we got our menus and gave drink orders. Our order took 15 minutes.   The burger patty(med well), cheese sauce, bread and fries were A+. The jalepeno slices on the bottom made the bun fall apart when I held it because the juice soaked the bun and made it taste overly vinegary. So I ate the burger with a fork and knife open faced style and disgarded the bottom bun. If you order this ask for jalapenos on the side.  The fries are aweeeesome. There were none left when I was done. Lots of crispies. Yum yum give me some.  I don't have an opinion on the pizza because it wasn't mine, but they loved it and ate it all. Just FYI, when you order the 2 slice deal, the pizzas are baked whole and sliced then stored in a 3 tiered rotating, heated, glass display. They are not cooked to order.  Total came to $16.15 with tax...but with tip was almost $20. Ouch. Right now with the lack of service I don't think paying full price here is worth it. There are lots of other places I can go for 1 burger & 2 slices of pizza for 20 bucks and get a better experience.  HOWEVER, on a half off pizza night or coming with a coupon would be worth it because for a discount I am willing to overlook the lack of service.   When we got the bill, that is the only time our server, Jemma/Gemma, came back to our table after delivering the food.  If you're here to watch sports for lunch you're out of luck. They have all of the TVs on but volume on zero with NO SUBTITLES. Music plays in the background (80s-90s laidback mix).   There is a full bar.    ==============================  If I could figure out, what they are known for, I can see this review becoming 4 stars. They really are good for basic bar food.    Tips: -Order the fries over the onion rings. -order the regular burger over angus (I've had both and angus is too mild. it's juicy but the beef taste is stronger on the reg. burgers. -order wings but if you don't want dry wings, perhaps order extra sauce. A lot of the reviews say the mild is tasteless. Perhaps order medium. People also seem to really like the hot. Expect less sauce than you would get at other places but the wings are meaty. You can also order these "double baked" which means they bake them in the pizza oven after deep frying. I assume this sets the sauce better? I have no idea. -Order the pizza, and also try the thin crust. (i'm a fan of thin crust and will try this next time) -Remember that wed night is half off pizza night

If you want Pizza, wings and beer this is the place to go.   The Pizza is always served hot and tasty. The price is reasonable as well. The staff is generally very attentive to your needs and always friendly.   They have a multitude of TV's that are viewable from just about anywhere in the joint and are always willing to change the channel on a TV near you if you want to watch a different sporting event than the one they have on.   The chicken wings are not as good as they used to be several years ago, but still darn tasty. Years ago they had more of a vinegar based sauce than today, but none the less are nice and tasty. If you want an adventure go with the suicide wings, if you are not as adventurous then go with the mild as they have little if any heat to them, but are fried up and have a wonderful flavor to them.  We have not tried many other things on the menu beyond the pizza, wings and an occasional salad. The few items we have tried are tasty, but not what I would call outstanding. Then again, they are about what you would expect from a place that is known for pizza, wings and beer.   ** Note the "outdoor seating" is  a couple of bistro chairs and tables on the sidewalk next to the parking lot and faces west so it is rather hot. I do not recommend the outdoor seating.

Beer is good but the pizza was over done.   The staff is attentive and get you anything you want.   Could not even get the Knights hockey game on one TV.   Does not support the local teams.   Fingers were good.

Once again tried to grab lunch with the family. Waited half an hour still no waitress.... This has to be the third time, always seems under staffed... Seen only one waitress that was doing everything.. If you don't mind a 2 hour meal if you can get a refill them you should be fine.... Food is great.... Put me in a bad mood...

Tried Jonny Mac from reviews on Yelp, nice place,  great local bar and restaurant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Tried the pizza, it was half off night. Nicely done good taste and quantity of toppings. Good beer selection, will try again if in the area, good family place and nice conversation with some local folks

My wife and I usually go here on Tuesdays for the half price pizza. Gotta love that pizza, especially when it's half price. Be sure and try the Burgers too, just great. My real love, though, is the suicide wings. I just can't get enough of them. These are not for the faint of heart, these are seriously hot wings. Be sure to wash your hands well before going to the bathroom though.
Every item on the menu taste great. They are famous for chicken wings and they are delicious. Staff is friendly like no where else. If you are coming to LV you have to make a stop to Johnny Mac's
Hawaiian pizza is amazing!  Great food and atmosphere, make sure and stop by if you are in the area!

In from OC for a high school baseball weekend. Limited time between games. They fully accommodated over 1/2 our team. Separate checks no problem!! Service awesome. Super friendly!! Would highly recommend!!
My family has been coming here for over 20yrs and it s still amazing!!  Still remember asking to have y birthday parties her as a kid.

We were looking for a place to eat before our LONG drive home. The first place we went to had a 20 minute wait, so we decided to leave. I checked out the reviews for Johnny macs and it looked SO good.   We got there pretty much when they opened at 11, so there weren't very many other people- it was great. The info on yelp doesn't do this place justice. If we lived here, this would be one of our regular spots. Their fried mushrooms were AMAZING, and their burgers are HUGE. I really wanted to try everything on their menu. They have pizza, sandwiches, wings, pasta- just a little bit of everything! Our server/hostess was wonderful- fast and attentive, I wish I got her name. I highly recommend this place. I already want to go back!

We stopped in on a Friday late morning.  Our intention was to have a couple bloody Mary's and hit the grocery store. When we walked in the owner was standing at a table in the bar area talking to a group of gentlemen. Nobody was behind the bar. We sat there for 7 minutes, watching employees mill about,  the owner talk to the table. Nobody approached us at all. When we got up to leave the owner was standing by the front counter and said "see you guys". Really?  Great customer service.  Needless to say we didn't say "see ya" back.

LOVE Johnny Mac's!!! We discovered it maybe a month ago and have been back at least a half a dozen times since then. The wait staff is wonderful. Very friendly and very fast. The food is amazing! I haven't had anything that I haven't liked. Burgers are huge and delicious, chicken tenders are crispy and huge as well. The pizza is the best I've had since I've lived in Nevada.

Great sports pub atmosphere.  My family went on Sunday night and was seated promptly at 7 pm.  Very good service.  Food was decent.  The wings were over done and the watermelon BBQ sauce was unique but didn't quite have a deep flavor profile like I expected.  Overall good experience though.
Delivery service has gone down. It has been sloppy the last few times. Also they never seem to have their famous sauce for the wings. We won't be ordering anytime soon.

Great Place.  Well run, friendly help and great food.  Daily specials are all tasty and worth the treat.  Every night gives a different vibe// good sports sometimes/good music others/great food always.  Try the linguini and bolognes!
The Pizza is really good here, but the wings are great! They have a bunch of different sauces but they arent necessary the traditional hot is killer. Best in town!
Best chicken sandwich, antipasto salad, and wings in town! Great place to bring the family because of the non smoking enviornment :-) Absolutely love this place!

This is one of my "regular" eating spots.  It is a small bar/restaurant that serves some great food.  I have eaten just about everthing on the menu and all have been great. My favorite is the sausage and pasta, but very often Ill have to get the wing/pizza combo with friends.  here is a little hint, they make a thin crust pizza too, i just found this out.  Its my favorite pizza in henderson. Get the wings extra crispy there good too. They always have a good number of staff there always keep your drink full. Also the owner is from Buffalo so the wing sauce is real buffalo sauce.
Holy cow amazing!!!! Awesome onion rings and wings!!! The burger was perfection, Destinee big cups best cups ever!!!!! & amazing customer service

I have been going to Johnny Mac's since I was a sophmore in high school. ( there might have been dinosaurs  roaming the earth at that time ... but we will act like it is just yesterday.) Back in the day I would go and get two slices of pizza and a coke for lunch. My girlfriends and I would sit and listen to Madonna on the jukebox and chat . At that time Johnny Macs was a very small one room eatery. Since that time it has grown into an actual sports bar with pizza and wings, pasta and many other delicious food items that will keep you coming back for more. Now me? I am a creature of habit. I get the same thing EVERY time ... Not because I am afraid to try new things ... it is just because I am never disappointed with what I order.  So ... last night was half price pizza night... SCORE! Mr. Abbott and I went and shared a pizza and a coke.  The pizza was PERFECT.  The cheese was melty and just the right amount of sauce.  I do mine up with a little parm and peppers...  Honestly it doesn't need anything added. This is the same recipe John has used since he opened the doors.  (I act like I know him ... I don't, but he is always there making sure that his customers are pleased) I watched one gentleman come in and John greeted him and the gentleman jokingly said "I will have a martini if YOU make it"  John walked behind the counter and said "Coming right up" and made him a martini that the gentleman said was "To die for" I will take his word for it.  You have to say something about a local place that keeps the same employees... for YEARS! it makes it feel like you are at cheers... or it is a family business.  We don't get to eat pizza as often as we used to we may splurge like every three months or something ... (stupid healthy eating getting in the way) But when we want pizza we don't go anywhere else.  and If I want wings... I would get them here to. Totally unique and traditional buffalo taste that is perfectly blended.  I can't say enough good things... but honestly... you should try it for yourself :)
The suicide wings are the best tasting wings I have ever had. As a Fins fan I am proud to say go Buffalo.
Great food. great local place. The service could be better but everyone was friendly.  Had wings and pizza. Couldn't go wrong.

Food was amazing we ordered one order of the wings and if was great!! Too spicy for the little one and we ordered it mild.  Service was slow which was upsetting because it was a nice restraint to eat at. Overall the food was great!
Awesome wings. Great burgers. Dont know about th he past reviews but the service was spot on.  Good times.

The food here is very good. On food alone, Johnny Macs is an easy 4* maybe 4.5*. I recommend the chicken tenders, but it's all pretty good. The service is pretty awful. Expect to wait a long time for just about anything--being seated, ordering, getting your food, etc. The thing is that the people that are working there are all nice and hard working, but there just aren't enough of them. They need to hire more staff.
Love it! Johnny Macs has the best pizza and chicken strips ever. Our favorite pizza place in the Las Vegas area for sure. :)
Johnny Mac's has awesome wings. The other food is good, however wings are always a must have. Johnny Macs is one of my favorite places to watch the Knights win games too!

This could be a 4 star review but I didn't think it deserved overall. We got the Henderson which is a large 1 item pizza and bucket of wings. The pizza is fine honestly just thought it would be more NY style and it's not, they even pre do the dough and it's just not me but is OK. The wings....quality of the wings was great BUY we asked for medium and it was just a awful buttered down hot sauce and didn't even taste like there was anything on them...had Franks red hot at the house and did some soaking. Overall I can just say it was OK and I've heard about this place forever.

This place has gone down hill during the past year. I used to go there quite frequently before as the food used to be good. I ordered some take out recently during the middle of the day and was very disappointed with this place. The pizza was overly salty, the crust was hard and tasted very bad. The wings were stringy and had fishy smell. The chicken sandwich was semi-OK, but the sauce was horrible. And the pasta! They put some red colored "sauce" which cannot be from a jar as even jar sauce tastes better than that.  The staff was not too friendly either, the middle aged lady at the counter greeted us with a very unfriendly bark.  Very bad experience, and definitely not going back.

Everything was fine but where is my avocado? Just kidding but thx for sending some out. Excellent tasting burger !!! Icey cold beer! Taking one of their Tuesday night specials home.  Order the Henderson special get your picture on the wall if you finish!

Johnny Mac's is located in a dingy shopping center, and you might miss it if you were just driving through; but don't judge a book by it's cover because I'd consider this place a hidden gem. It's a cute Irish pub with a dark ambiance and some great food. From the pizza to the wings, from the mozzarella sticks to the chicken tenders, this place is bound to have your favorite comfort food. I highly recommend you try this place out. It's definitely a Henderson classic!

This was my 1st time trying Johnny Macs. Didn't have any expectations but I needed wings on National wing day and I also needed to feed the kids. Checking out the menu I saw The Henderson special. 5 pounds of wings and a large pizza.  Boom! Problem solved.   So thats what we got. 3 different flavors of wings and a pepperoni pizza.   The wings were crispy and good. The hot flavor actually had some spice and good flavor. The wings were a good size too. Not  jumbo or small.   The pizza was also really good.   They make their own blue cheese dressing which normally I am not a fan of but theirs was good and went well with the wings.   I took home enough food for a few more meals.   I'll be back to Johnny Macs very soon.   If you're in the fence give it a try. I doubt you'll be disappointed.
Best pizza and wings!  Staff is always really friendly too. Love the new updates. I live in Michigan and I have to come here every time I visit my mom.

Worst pizza place i had for pick up.  Pizza is not warm at all although we got there earlier than promised time of 15 minutes. We ordered sausage only and they put pepperoni and ham. We also want pepper and mushrooms in it but no veggies at all. The tomato sauce is not enough, cant barely taste it.   We didn't realized it was wrong until we get home..   The chicken was overcooked and seems they just poured the sauce in it and wasnt cooked in.   We will never order or dine in here. Ever. Very disappointed
What's very happy with the service. Sat at a table next to the bar for over 30 minutes and no service. No one ever came up to me about anything. Was pretty upset.

Though the food is good, and we haven't been here for about 2 years, the wait service sucks.  My husband's diet coke was empty  must of the time. And we waited forever for a box to take home our food, I finally got the hostess to get us one. And waiting for the check is ridiculous.  Only come for the food and come with a lot of time.

A great little local's spot with delicious wings and pizza.  There are TVs mounted on every wall, so each seat has a great view if you want to catch a game.  While it is listed primarily as a bar, there is lots of seating and whenever we go it is full of families. Also, the owner is often there and can be seen greeting customers and even serving at times-- adds to the family owned small business charm.

Awesome Buffalo food! When you are looking for that Buffalo flavor- wings, pizza, beef on weck. ... all delicious, just like being back in Buffalo. Since growing up there I am constantly looking for food that matches the flavor and now we have! Johnny Macs is the place. Great atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious food   You have to check it out!
Pretty ok pizza although a little greasy. The atmosphere is what youd expect, nothing fancy but its a good place to have a drink and a few slices.

well I've been a long time/ loyal patron. Like clockwork every Thursday night after work  we order pizza and wings for delivery. The drivers all know our address (we tip well) always telling us 45 minutes. This Thursday night as usual we order, wait 45 minutes understanding it's now football season after an hour we call. Gal says she can't call delivery guy but it should be delivered soon.  Now it's 1.5 hours later no pizza no call  what good is it if their loyal customers are disregarded because they're to busy due to football. I will never call them again WHAT A SLAP IN THE FACE! BTW after a long day I went to bed hungry. Johnny I hope you read this

great place...salads were huge and very well done.  ribs were excellent, great texture.....awesome wings and really, really good pizza.  excellent service and very hands on family ownership.  was very glad we came into this place while staying in lake las vegas.

We have never had a bad experience here! We started coming here about 2 months ago and now come at least once a week for (the best) wings! We have also gotten pizza, fried pickles, and mozzarella cheese sticks. Service is fantastic! Laid back atmosphere. You won't be disappointed trying this place!
Good food. Good atmosphere. Good people. Good service. Good rates. Cold drinks.   .....why would you not want to go to Johnny Mac's?? TRY IT! It's awesome.

Short and to the point... this place was kinda grungy but NOT in that good Seattle way, the food tasted ok but my ribs were cold in the middle, good pricing IF you get what you pay for (that might be a big IF), and the lady behind the bar was nice. I'm probably gonna go back to try the wings because I hear good things about them... we"ll see...
Jalapeño green beans with avocado ranch are amazing!!! Pizza is a little on the pricy side but is half off on Wednesdays!

We have been going to Johnny Mac for years, but, lately we noticed a change in pizza dough. The dough is made ahead of time and stacked.  I love crust and there was none! Please don't change your recipe!!!!

Our party of four picked a new place for our monthly lunch experience. Johnny Mac's centrally located in a strip mall on Boulder Hywy. I had read the reviews and felt this was a sure shot and would please everyone. Wrong. Entering we were greeted enthusiastically by servers and bartender alike. Let me state upfront...the service could not have been better. Absolutely the best. The place was clean and pleasant with some gaming and the ususal gaggle of TV's. Seating ( beside the bar) is a combination of tall tables and booths. Promptly seated in the booth of our choice and were told of the daily specials and given menu's,very extensive.  We ordered a medium cheese pizza with olives and pepperoni,  a salad with grilled chicken, 1lb of chcken wings with a small Caesar salad and a BBQ/Bacon hamburger. The pizza and mild wings were very good and the  chicken on the salad was tasty. The burger was way overcooked/dry and the greens on all the salads (all four) were mushy and appeared to have been frozen at one time. The croutons were soft. Our suggestion: pizza and wings. I know we should have said something to the server but after driving over from Summerlin we were very hungry at that point.

CHILD PLEASE! I'm from Chicago and I know pizza so I say this without pause. This pizza is a glorified little ceasars or pizzahut . Otherwise this is just a normal joint in the hood. Nothing special as far as pizza is concerned. I was critical of the pizza because it was supossed to be this great place for pizza , but its not!

If you want to eat the best wings in town while having a beer/cider and enjoying either a sporting event or classic rock music in the background, this is your place! Buffalo Wild Wings and Wing Nutz have nothing on this place - honestly.  We were in search of a wing place that offered a variety of sauces, had a great atmosphere, was reasonably priced, and offered excellent customer service. Well we finally found the place. It is a little drive from where we live, but definitely well worth it.   The garlic cilantro and watermelon BBQ were my favorite wing sauce choices. I had an Angry Orchard cider and enjoyed the classic rock music and good company while he enjoyed his lemon pepper and suicide wings, pizza, and a cold bottled beer while watching the races on one of the many television sets near our booth. The wings are just how we like them - crisp, meaty, and flavorful.   Although we didn't go to Johnny Mac's intending to eat a pizza, our server made us aware of the numerous specials they have. Some are on specific days and some are grouped with certain orders. For example, we had ordered 5lbs of wings. So, he informed us about the Henderson Special that groups a large one-item pizza with 5lbs of wings for what amounted to about $7.00 more. We have no problem with leftovers with two teenage boys and thought for that price - why not! The pizza was also very good!  One of the things I personally enjoy about going out to eat is the adventure in meeting new people and having some friendly conversation with our good food. While there, a nearby employee hearing us question whether or not the restaurant used to be a car shop because of it's two garage-like doors near the entrance, came over and made light conversation with us. He told us that the restaurant opens those doors on nice days, but that there was a history behind the doors as it was not the original design. He showed us a picture on his phone of a car that drove right through the front of the building two years ago. He said after that, the owners took the insurance money and instead of rebuilding the wall, installed glass windows that open like a garage door. I looked at his phone and laughed as I saw this car literally sticking out of Johnny Mac's and told him that this conversation piece should certainly be framed and put on the wall - just a thought!   Anyway - we will definitely be back!

I have been in here several times pre Yelp to have a couple of cocktails or grab a bit to eat.  It has always been a sandwich or burger.  I had yet to try their famous wings or pizza.  The other day I went and had lunch.  I automatically spotted the sliced pizza rotating in it's display.  I thought that would be the way to go.  When I was sat at my table, I was advised by the server that the special was meatloaf.  I love meatloaf and did not want to pass that up or the pizza slice for that matter so I ordered both.  The pizza is in fact some of the best bar pizza I have ever had.  I sure it's stock would improve dramatically after a good night of boozing.  The meatloaf arrived and I was taken back by the shear size of slab that lay before me.   It arrived with a mountain of mashed potatoes and brown gravy with wonderful looking mushrooms thrown in.  There was also a nice caesar salad that came with the meal.  I took my time and watched those that were drinking at the bar on a Monday afternoon.  Everyone seemed very happy and knew each other. The staff seemed really focused on all those that they knew.  As for me not being a familiar face, I got the tourist treatment.  I doubt that I will ever become a bar fly at Johnny Mac's.  I can totally deal with that.  I am pretty sure that when ever I am jonesing for a slice of that pizza, I will probably make my way there again.

By far my favorite pizza!! I don't know I went so long without knowing of this place! I don't even live in Henderson and I have it once a week. They have a great menu, I love the vibe inside and everyone is always great with service weather it's Tuesday evening or Friday! I was just in for St. Patrick's day and it was insanity (in a good way ) and still didn't mind waiting, it was a great time. I usually get it Togo and girl that checks me out is always sweet and patient. Johnny Macs is my #1
The server, Erica, is awesome and made my birthday dinner so special!! Every time I go there, I request for her table and receive excellent service every time!

I've been eating chicken tenders here for over 20 years.   Wow, did I just say that?  In those 20 years they have maintained themselves as the gold standard of chicken tenders. The sauces are awesome. The chicken is well cooked. The breading is properly applied and of a good thickness. There are never any of those fried breading balls covered in sauce with no chicken inside. The ranch dressing is great.   Here's the best part: the bleu cheese dressing is amazing. They make it in-house, I'm told, and it is the best bleu cheese dressing I've ever had. Not only that, but one of the only ones I can stand. I hate bleu cheese. I take a perverse pleasure in convincing others that hate bleu cheese to try it. I've never had a person dislike it!   I live 40 minutes away from this place but it is only 5 minutes from my parents' house and as a kid I used to work at the Smith's with which it shares a parking lot. It's nice to see a place stand up to the test of time. It's always sad to have a place you loved as a kid be revealed as low-rent dumpster food you liked because you didn't know any better. Johnny Mac's is the opposite: food that has always been truly good and hopefully will continue to be until I'm too old to taste it anyway.

Always great food and service. The wings are the best in town. They do a great burger and roast beef on wreck. Never disappointed. I've been going there for 4years. Most my local friends have been going there since they opened on the regular.

Whenever a discussion about the best chicken wings comes up on Yelp Talk, Johnny Mac's is always an honorable mention- which is what put them on my radar. But I came in with a friend on Wednesday, their half price pizza night, and didn't have room for them. But I definitely want to come back, if only for the novelty of watermelon BBQ sauce!  As I said, pizzas are half price on Wednesdays (dine-in only), and they have other daily specials like BOGO pastas (Thursdays) each day of the week. We went for an early dinner around 4PM and by 5PM there was a standing room only wait- this spot is popular! Despite the crowd, servers came by consistently, were friendly, and did not rush us out, which was much appreciated.  Food was solid- we started with an app order of Cowboy Bites, fried balls of corn, cheese, jalapeno, and olive, with a southwest dipping sauce. They were tasty but I would probably try something else in the future. For our pizza, we decided on the California White (EVOO, tomato, basil, garlic, ricotta, artichokes, roasted peppers, and mozz)- even the small was huge and more than enough for the two of us to share. Pizza was super cheesy with lots of veggies, which was appreciated. Despite all the toppings, I felt something was missing, and added a bit of the app dipping sauce to my pie for a bit more zing. I'd come back to try another pie or those wings though!

I have been here multiple times, and gotten something different each time. I really wanted to like this place, but the prices are too high and the food is simply not good. I even got food poisoning from the lasagna once.

I had really high hope for this place.  Walked in around 2pm.  We thought it would be the perfect time to try this place when it's not too busy.  Standing there...  standing there.  We had to wait about 5 minutes for someone to acknowledge we were there and tell us just to sit wherever.  Hmm.  Ok.   Luckily the bartender/waitress came over right away and got our drink order.  We decided to split some wings since many of the yelpers loved them.  Now I don't know if it was an off day for them, but our wings were way over done. They seemed dry and tough.  Bummer man. I had really high hopes for them since my husband loves wings.  Saving grace was my turkey, bacon and avocado sandwich.  It was huge!  The meat was stacked so high that I couldn't open my mouth wide enough to take a bite.  They accompanied the sandwich with so many fries that I couldn't finish them all.  This portion of my visit was fantastic.  Other than my sandwich, the rest (service and wings) was just ok.  I'm always one to give places a second chance.  Maybe our next visit will be better.
Always great food and service! The food is always wonderful. They can accommodate a party of 2 or large family. I love the remodel.

You can not beat the wings. It is that simple. The chicken strips are yummy too. If you are lucky to live close enough, they will even deliver it. But the delivery hours are kind of weird so make sure you call and ask before you make it your plan.

Wish everyday was fish fry Friday!! That's when they make the Beer Battered Cod here. Flaky, light and fresh. Plus points for having Heinz Malt Vinegar for the condiment!  Wish everyday was Beef Weck Saturday!! That's the only time they make Beef on a Weck here! It's Mr.B's favorite. Quality roast beef, thinly sliced, plied on a kummelweck roll. (yes they offer it on Friday too...shhh)   Oh wish it was St Patricks Day everyday too! They dish out some awesome Irish dishes! The only time you can get  their delicious Corned Beef and Cabbage..  All meat for burgers, sandwiches, even chicken if I'm not mistaken is all fresh, not frozen.  So what else is good to order on the rest of the days?  The BBQ SPARERIBS slathered in the bbq watermelon sauce. Ribs are slow baked and only a few of them each day so once it's gone it's gone!   Broasting method used to make chicken wings! Says so on the menu too. The broasted method has less grease, results in plump, juicer chicken. I like both garlic parmesan and watermelon. People order these by the 5lb buckets though lately. What the heck!   Also what the heck... Wednesdays this place is craaaaazy busy! Pizza day! Not sure what the promo is since I don't order pizza ...half off?..but my friends and family are willing to wait 30 minutes for a table to free up.   Which leads me to mention that I've been holding off on this review for selfish reasons. #SorryNotSorry..lol...place has enough rave Yelp reviews and you guys are taking up my table! But congrats on getting People Love Us on Yelp..very cool JMac!  The place to watch a football, baseball, basketball game if you ask me.  Large TV screens everywhere so wherever you sit, you have a good view. Mr. B calls it the perfect Irishman's man cave! Complete with beer,sports memorabilia and taxidermy animal heads on the wood paneled walls.   The restaurant sits  in the Smiths shopping center Friendly Donut House is a few doors down.  On nice days when there is no wind the doors slide out and we have fresh air and a lovely view of the parking lot.     Ive never had any problems with service in the 20+ times Ive been here. Even on the super busy nights, the JMac crew work as a team.  Youve got the host/hostess that seats you. Another person who takes your drink order and makes the rounds refilling your drinks, Your main server, another employee who makes the rounds to each table to see how everything is....sometimes John JMac himself is in the house and will come by to see how you are doing. Everyone is friendly and super tolerant of some of their senile elderly customers that are demanding.   The vibe here is cool and has a locals feel to it. I don't mind sitting in the bar area here. Everyone is pretty chill and the bartenders are on top of things. Love that it's NON SMOKING and dining area is family friendly. It's no wonder why it's been around now for 31 years!

It was a rainy November Vegas night. Accidentally tried this place about a year ago when I needed to take my girlfriend out for a pizza night, little did I know I was about to find the Holy Grail of chicken wangz. We both agreed after our first pound of crack that Johnny Macs was our go to place for wings and anywhere else would be a betrayal. We've even gave a few places around town a shot like 702 Wings, and VooDoo wings. Not even remotely the same. Do yourself a favor and come here, especially when a VGK game is on and you can get a nice cold $3 Draft with your crack. I mean wings!

Went here for our 5th time last week and took a friend who has never been.   We were dicing but all of us got away with having to try drinks which was good.  I was so looking forward to the ravioli with the tomato sauce and was a bit disappointed when it came out, perhaps they changed the recipe but it used to have a spicy kick to it and now it was just tomato sauce but thats alright.  The food and service was amazing!  And its been remodeled and we loved that except the bathroom used to be private and now its public--Meaning it used to be one room with a locking door and now its not, I dont like that at all but hey, Im a weirdo.    :)  We will be back!

Awful.  I was initially attracted by the picture outside that had a rack of mouth-watering ribs (which, by the way, looks nothing like the actual product).  I'm so glad I only ordered the half rack, because I found the "watermelon" BBQ sauce nauseating.  It lacks any sort of intensity or flavor, so it was almost like I was eating the ribs naked, which essentially tastes like bland pork.  However, I did see the people next to me eating wings and they looked a helluva lot better than what I ordered, so maybe I might go back and try something else.  But not soon, because I inadvertently under-tipped my waiter by miscalculating the total cost (I had only brought cash).  Oh well.

Was at Johnny Mac's again last week. and as always the service was great and the food was excellent .  I live out of town and every time I'm in town I make a effort to go there because the food is excellent.  Looking forward to my next visit in a few months.

A little hole in the wall.  Always very friendly service and easily the best wings in town.  Great value and had the pizza a few times which is also good - but come for some cold beer, good service and great wings!

This place used to be great but after the remodel the service went down as did the quality of the food.  Last night I was in there with some friends from out of state and we got 2 of the Henderson Specials with 2 watermelon BBQ, 1 medium hot wings and 1 honey BBQ wings.  The wings came dry with a pile of thick jelly type sauce poured in the middle on only a couple wings out of the of wings in each baskets.  That's 4 baskets of wings un-tossed.  I asked them to please toss one order of watermelon BBQ wings with the sauce and they brought them back and said they just made me a new batch but the new batch didn't have any sauce at all.  The server didn't feel like refilling our drinks (we weren't asking for excessive refills,this was after the first time asking for a refill and waiting 15 minutes to get 1 pitcher of water tossed on the table for 9 people to share).  He filled my husbands cup and dumped water all over his lap and then left us a pitcher and said we could refill them ourselves.  We were a little embarrassed as we had told our out of town guest about how great this place was.  This is the second time in a row I've had poor service and had to return my food to the kitchen, last time they served my 4 year old hot wings on accident instead of watermelon BBQ wings that I had ordered for her.

We just moved from the east Vegas area to Henderson, so we're on the lookout for our local place to go for pizza and chicken fingers. This place was not the winner. We were told a 20 minute wait and it was actually 45 minutes. They were on a 2 hour wait for to-go orders so we were thinking this would be spectacular. Buuuut... no. $15 for a 12 inch cheese pizza?! Wowzers! It was completely over baked, the cheese was dark brown. Working in customer service management myself, I'm surprised it was able to leave the kitchen. They made a new one which was nice!, but actually wish we just asked for it off the bill. The new one was cooked better, just still not a fan. $12 for 5 chicken finger and no fries? $15 for over cooked fish and chips? The good things were: the onion rings, my husband liked his beef sandwich ($15 I believe, should have kept my receipt), and the kids meals were a good price and value. Overall, $90 for (overcooked) bar food? Meh. We left saying "well we tried it, but don't need to come back."  P.S. To the people that do go, please don't take up the few large tables they have for 3 hours. The servers miss out on money from it as well as it being an inconvenience for those waiting.

Westin Employee referred us to Johnny Mac's. The best service. Not only by our waitress Katie, but all other floor employees walked by asking if we were ok. Food was good, pizza was very filling. I'll definitely come back if I'm on vacation in the area again.

Johnny Mac's is a great local pub with some of the best food in town. The Big Vin is my favorite sandwich and I sometimes eat here 4 or 5 times a month, it's that good. The chicken wings are also some of the best you'll ever find and if you're in a daring mood try the Suicide flavor. It'll melt your tastebuds off your tongue.

I was expecting something way better after reading all the reviews.  The pizza was bland and nothing special as was the beef on weck sandwich.  Nothing at all made this place stand out... im going to just stick to going to Bistro Pizza in henderson off Gibson.... food is WAY better

Very dive-y looking in the front. We decided to try it out a few months ago when I was pregnant. Wasn't terribly impressed. We ordered a meat plate/sampler, that just had the meat and cheese thrown on there. When our pizza finally came, there was a pool of grease sitting on top of it. I've had it better frozen, out of a box.  For whatever reason, we decided to give them a second chance, with delivery, about a month later.  There was a mile long black hair baked into our pizza. NO thanks, never again.
Always busy, but great service. Wings are yummy. We order takeout frequently and they never get our order wrong!

Accidentally ran across Johnny Mac's and glad we decided to stop by! Quick and friendly service! Got the meat lovers pizza and Johnny mac classic burger and of course enjoyed a few adult beverages... no complaints all around!! Thank you and look forward to coming again soon!!

This establishment is good for a big party because they take reservations.  As for the food, I have mixed reviews.  The restaurant claimed to serve New York style pizza.  Unfortunately, the pizza did not taste like a NY pizza.  The crust was soggy and there was too much sauce on the pizza.  However, their chicken wings were excellent.  The BBQ ribs were also very tasty.  Overall, I would return for the ribs  and chicken wings.

The food is good but the bartenders are mostly garbage. They don't know what their own specials are. I called Saturday morning specifically asking if they had Cox Cable and PAC12 network (dish and direct don't have PAC12) because I was planning to watch the Oregon ducks football game there. Guy on phone assured me they had the channel and will show the game. Upon arrival, no Cox Cable, no PAC12, no ducks game. Pissed me off somethin fierce. Still passed about it.

Two words Henderson Special. It has wings, pizza and salad for a very reasonable price. The wings are crisp and juicy, the sauce perfectly seasoned. The pizza is greasy and flimsy. The salad crisp and fresh. This is my favorite place for date night. I wish they delivered, but every time I call the driver isn't working :-( Service is slow, but who cares, give me my wings and leave me alone. It's as close to perfection as any sports bar will ever get in my life.

If I could give zero stars I would!!! Waited over an hour for a table for my aunt to celebrate her birthday. The owner just gave away our table for his own personal friends! Horrible business tactics. Been coming here for years and I promise that myself and the other 13 individuals I was with will NEVER return!

we loved this place! had to grab dinner that night and found some great deals on food and drinks. they know how to make a whiskey ginger!  I'd only say the fish n chips need a looking at, good but maybe the oil temperature was off?  I'd get it again to compare for sure though!

This is always one of my favorite places to eat. Always such good service, food and drinks. Every time I have someone visit from out of town I bring them here because it's so close to my house. LOVE this place! I definitely recommend if you're looking for a new local spot.

A happening place. This is a family run restaurant/bar/pub with excellent food. When we first went to see this restaurant 5 years ago, we were disappointed as it was in a strip mall and looked like a biker bar. We gave it a chance a few months later and have never been disappointed. It is our favorite restaurant in Henderson with five star food. We have never been disappointed in the food. The servers are very friendly and attentive. This is a local bar and has it's regulars but everyone is given wonderful service. Very much a sports bar with the owner coming to Las Vegas years ago from Buffalo~~
Good food and service - only complaint was the lighting was a little too dark

I am giving this place 5 stars for the wings and boneless strips.  They are awesome!!!  I usually order them with the SUICIDE sauce which is VERY HOT, but has a lot of flavor as well.  Ive been going to this place for about the last 20 years or longer.  I do think the pizza is a little expensive, but it is also very good.

Great atmosphere for lunch. I had a grilled chicken sandwich with a side salad and the wife had the lunch special 2 slices of pizza and a soda. She raved the pizza and said it was a top 5 pizza she has ever had. My chicken sandwich was good, but I traditionally order safe cleaner food. It was about as good as a chicken sandwich could be! Toasted bun made it much better than if it was just a plain jane bun. Service was awesome. Both gentlemen were friendly, accommodating, and helpful! Would definitely come back if I were to stay in the Henderson area again.

I went to Johnny Macs on Sunday and here are my thoughts.  The food was perfect for a bar type of venue.  I had the Roast Beef on Weck, (a roast beef sandwich on a salty kaiser roll....it's a Buffalo thing), and it was fantastic.  The buffalo wings were great.  They had the right crispy texture on the outside with the meat nice and tender underneath.  The place is a "dive bar" but is very far from being a dive.  If I didn't live on the other side of town I'd be there all the time.  Regardless, I plan on going back any opportunity I get.

Probably the 3rd or 4th time I've been to Johnny Mac's now and they're just as awesome as ever.   Their white pizza is great. No boring Alfredo sauce here.  I've also ordered a regular pizza with jalapeño and pineapple. Their 6" is the perfect size for one person. Nice crust, on the thin side but not so thin it's hard as a rock.   Their homemade garlic bread is one of my favorites. Packed with garlic, topped with a tomato slice and the perfect amount of melty cheese. It's served with a side of marinara which my girlfriend goes without because of the onions. Otherwise no complaints.   Most recently I ordered the pasta primavera. It normally comes with Alfredo sauce but I only like white sauce on my pizza so I opted for marinara instead. It. Was. FANTASTIC. Garlic, tomatoes, artichokes, broccoli. The portion size was huge and it came with garlic bread.   While I was devouring my pasta deliciousness, my girlfriend was enjoying the chicken club panini. Simple but wonderfully done, only comment would be the honey mustard sauce on it. Normally honey mustard has kind of a tang to it and while some of it was, some of the mustard tasted more dull and creamy. Maybe like they used the mayonnaise knife to spread it or something.  All that said, johnny macs continues to impress and satisfy.

Best burger I've ever had!! Took my husband there and he said the same thing. Waitress was nice and quick. It was a busy Thursday and all of the staff seemed to be working hard. We didn't wait very long for a table.

Great place, I searched for best chicken wings in Henderson and this popped up.  Read the reviews and thought we'd give it a try.  Wow on the way out a young lady called Lou was super friendly and told us how to get the chicken wings next time:  "Double Bake"  Apparently the chefs will know what it means.  They dip them in hot sauce (which is very hot by the way, we had it with our pizza (yes we meant to have only wings but it was half off pizza night)  So apparently, the "double bake" is wings in hot sauce that get run through the pizza oven.  Also, the wings we had tonight were "Mild" and "extra crispy."  A great combination, although not as saucy as you would expect, the balance of flavors was superb.  Will eat again.

Back in 2006ish - 2007, this place really was a hit. Now if you enjoy running to the bathroom before your last bite, head on in and grab yourself some diarrhea food. Guarantee you'll have the worst gas of your life.

This is a really nice neighborhood bar and restaurant.  It is a great place to watch the game.  It's also a great place to bring the family for pizza and wings.  The staff is really friendly and very accommodating.    I like everything on the menu.  The wings are their specialty, but the pizza is really good too.  Last time I was there was with a large group of friends.  We were able to feed 12 people for $150 including drinks and gratuity.  We all left full and had food left over.  You can't beat a value like that.

I am selecting zero stars.  I certainly hope these guys sell a lot of beer, because they are not interested in selling pizza or wings.  Walked it to do a take out order, that seemed to be a pain to the girl waiting on me, she promptly told me that all the specials on the board were no good for take out orders.  (This is advertised as a take-out place) Then she said we have a pizza/wing special for 39.00.  This doesn't sound like a special to me, Im sorry.  Then I actually tried to order a 12 inch pizza which they obviously weren't interested in selling because it went from $12.00 to $18.00 because of a boxing charge for take out orders.  At that point I left, I wasn't going to wait thirty minutes to get charged a boxing charge for a pizza.

Been eating at johnny mac's for as long as I can remember!! This place is a henderson land mark. Great food, friendly people, cant go wrong with ANYTHING on the menu, the wings are the best around, and the pizza is always great.

Wings are OK, but expensive for what you get. Service is very poor if they are busy. Had our waiter walk by and ask if everything was OK. He didn't even stop for me to answer. I had to flag down a bus boy to finally get a refill.

BOY OH BOY! Not sure where to even start... i ordered bbq wings and the California  burger. Hands down best wings i have ever tried! The wings are very saucy just the way i like them! Ive been to so many wing places and none have ever tasted like this. If you like saucy you will Love this. Finished all the wings..... still wanting more. No wonder they were voted the best wings in Vegas! This restaurant looks like a little hole in the wall on the outside but is actually a great hangout sports bar. Everything is super casual and we had great service from the moment we were greeted till the moment we walked out the door.  All the Locals love this place & i know people who drive from across town just for the wings and cheese pizza, I dont blame them! This place is great for families or just a night out.
Food is outstanding. Not much draft beer selection and the machines at the bar are very stingy. Best antipasto salad and hot wings in town.

Overall we enjoyed our visit.  The soda drinks are served in HUGE containers which was entertaining when they first arrived.  The wings we ordered were disappointing in that they were dry and thin on meat - the staff graciously offered to replace them but we decided to skip it and they instead removed them from our bill - greatly appreciated!  The pizza we ordered, the Johnny Mac special with mushrooms added was very generous on toppings.  I'd prefer my crust a little thinner than the pizza we were served but overall it was an enjoyable pie!

Tried to go to this place with the wife and another couple on St. Patrick's Day. Yeah, that was a bad idea. The place was jammed packed! We got there around 5pm and were told about an hour wait. We waited about 45 minutes and asked and found out we were still 15 parties down the list so decided to go elsewhere.   I was so intrigued to try the place based on recommendation of a couple guys I know that have lived in Vegas for 15+ years so I went back AGAIN a day later by myself. I walked in and grabbed an immediate seat at the bar, no wait.   I went with 2lbs of buffalo wings, hot, with fries. The bartender was nice enough to give me the bar special which made it probably $8 cheaper so I really appreciate her for that. I asked and she recommended I try the secret baked wings and I did.   I am a huge wing lover and these were without a doubt. The best wings I've had in town. I am glad I live in Henderson and can easily make my way back here to dine again.   For a place that doesn't look like much from the outside, or inside for that matter, I was really impressed with the bathroom. It was clean and updated. So extra kudos for that.   Highly recommend you give this place a shot too!

Been to Johnny Mac's a few times, had the ribs smothered with the watermelon BBQ sauce.  Very very good!!  I also tried a few of their burgers and they were kick ass!  Very messy but very very good.  My girlfriend is hooked on the teriyaki chicken fingers.  The service has been fantastic every time we visited this place.  The best time to go is during happy hour, better deal on drinks!

A Henderson staple!  I did not like this place in high school.  I thought it was too dark and the food was not up to par with other places around town.  Fast forward almost 10 years and we frequent here because my friends grew up on it and they have half off pizzas on Wednesdays!  They just renovated the entire restaurant and it looks real nice although the tables by the bar are wayyy too small and kind of in the way of people trying to sit at the bar.  It's very hard to eat pizza here with two people.    I know a lot of people who say this is the best pizza in town and I immediately have to argue with them.  This pizza isn't bad by any standards and I think has improved since I was in high school but it is nowhere near the best.  Johnny Mac's is a Henderson staple where the big whigs from city hall and the regular joes come and break bread together.  I love this aspect of it!  Everybody has their own reason to like it and I think this is what differentiates it from other local spots like PT's.
Great pizza, great wings, great people. A bit far from town but a great local spot. We shall return!

First pizza came out burnt on the bottom and gooey dough under all the toppings ... sorry don't eat raw dough so .. sent back the waiter saw it and understood.. made us another one but by the time it came out we got it to go ... got back to the condo and another raw dough pizza ... after I baked it in the oven for 10 mins it was very good !

Customer service!!! They got it. I was amazed how attentive, direct, the follow-up and this was for a to go order. Great job you guys put a smile on my face and I have even gotten to the food which looks great

This one is for you Jer.... Mr. Mac I hear migrated from the mother land of wings(buffalo). Now I like pizza, I have been a long time conasaur of wings. I have sampled a good 100 or so wings from the Anchor Bar. The establishment that claims started this delicacy. Johnny could use bat wings battered and dipped in his wingy sauce and I would still think they are taste o' licious. Some sauces are meant to be sopped up with your left over pizza crust and Mac's is on that list. I travel a good 30miles round trip to partake on his wingy dingies. Make sure you ask for extra sauce on your babies because the secret is in the sauce when it comes to wings. The meat is meaty also, you rarely ever get that bastard stepchild of a wing all small over crisp and retarded. Mac's is on my list when I think of purchasing wings for myself or chowing down with the guys. Shalom Johnny Macs.

As a Buffalo native, I was excited to find this place while visiting the area.  I was disappointed that I didn't see some of my Western NY favorites (Vernor's ginger ale, loganberry and haddock fish fry) but was very happy with the pizza we ordered.  (Although I would have liked the classic Buffalo-style rectangular cut.). We got the cheese pizza and it was delicious.  There was a 1/2 off pizza deal that made lunch there even more appealing.  Service was a little lacking but the good food and great price made up for it in my eyes.

Love this place. It's a whole in the wall bar in a strip mall. Our friends happened upon it through their business and highly recommended it. We've been here twice (3 if you count the time we had them deliver pizza to the house) and have not been disappointed. The prices are reasonable, the food is excellent and so is the service. Plus, it's not too far from our house. We'll definitely be back regularly.

These reviews made me think this place was good. What a disappointment. Maybe it's good when you're drunk and can't taste the food. Highly over-rated. 35 dollars for wings and tenders that were not even mediocre. They at least were kind enough to refund me the money.
Friendly staff, great atmosphere and really good food. Try the deep fried pickles. They are hard to find in Vegas and this place makes them great.
Came in for lunch got the spinach salad special, wow one of best salad   I've had. Normally I get a sandwich or pasta. As always Gemma gives great service at bar, very friendly staff.

What a great atmosphere it is in Johnny Mac's.  It has that feel of a local's place where everyone knows your name.  The food was superb and the service was stellar.  I can't wait to go back, I highly recommend this place.  Try the Chicken Parmesan Sandwich!

I heard about this place from some friends who live in Boulder City.  When I pulled up I was a little apprehensive because it isn't the best looking area.  The place is nice inside though.  The atmosphere is great and the staff is very nice.  They are known for their wings and pizza, and for good reason. I love the wings!  The pasta is good also and they have different specials every day.  I go here all the time now.
Been going there for many years now, hands down the best wings in town. Love their watermelon wings and the pizza is great as well.
Sooooo Delicious! Tried the roast beef on Wek, twas the Monday special. I loved it! Horseradish and a Pickle on the side...with  Au Jus.  Good Pizza also, I will go back when I'm in the Vegas area.
The meatball sub is bomb and huge, I've had so many where the meatballs were dry this one was juicy.

We stopped in while on Vacation from CA and I cannot express how happy we were. From the outside you don't know what to expect. When you walk in you are welcomed with smiles and pure hospitality. The cups are HUGE so refills probably don't happen often however someone offered to top us off!!! What!?!?! It was beyond nice. We had mozzarella sticks and pizza and it was amazing. Great food, ballgames on TV, fun music, and wonderful people. I highly recommend!!!

This was the second time we have been here and the experience was like night and day. Our server was not very good, we ordered appetizers that never showed up, everyones food showed up but my sister in laws, she got her food about 10 minutes later. Then when our bill showed up we were charged for extra beer and there were charges then charges taken away, we were confused. We will go back again!  The wings, pizza and fish fry were good!!!!!!! Beers were cold!!!! It's a busy place.........

Our hostess Christine was courteous and double checked with chef if the items we ordered were vegetarian. We tried the pasta primavera and the alfredo fettuccine for kids. It was tasty nonetheless. The garlic bread was really good, we loved it. Great service as well.

So happy I FINALLY talked my boyfriend into going here. I used to grub here at least once a week when I worked up at the lake. Bar food yes, but way more than that. Sandwiches and fresh pastas. Daily specials that you can almost never go wrong with. I've had a meatloaf sandwich as a special, chicken Marsala and omg the egg fettuccine noodles were so yummy. Fish fry Fridays.  Good service, not AMAZING but it seems like a family style spot with a decent crew. Not a chain joint, and did I mention they have watermelon wings?  Minors are allowed in the restaurant area, I've yet to check out the bar but the bartenders were all young and attractive. Seems like it would be a cool place to watch a game, unless your going against the team playing the Bills, cuz this is def a buffalo bar!

A local favorite. Though it does get busy, we have never had to wait longer than a few minutes. Service has always been fast and friendly. Prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is that of a small locals favorite spot, and that's exactly what it is. We always seems to stick with what we know is delicious here- wings, fries, onion rings and pizza.

This is a hole in the wall place in the Smith's shopping center, I stumbled on this place shortly after moving back to the area and was staying at mom's up the street....really needed a break!  Found this place with COLD beer and great food.    The lasagna is very good, as is the meatball sandwich- their fries are crispy and fresh.    Have had the Panini and that was also tasty.    It gets really busy here during sporting events and on the weekend, normally I haven't waited very long but it does get very crowded and can be a bit noisy.   The parking can get a bit hairy but its fairly close no matter where you have to park.    All in all, I really like this place, good drink and good food.  I'll go back!!
This place is great place to go on a date or with the family. Affordable prices, lots of options and excellent service. Very highly recommended!
This is a real find! The food was very tasty & reasonable, the wait staff friendly. Lots of people there but it wasn't noisy. Great atmosphere. Wish we had one in NLV!

I can't keep my mind off of pizza today for some reason, and thinking about Johnny Mac's isn't helping any.  This pizzeria's been around in Henderson for literally as long as I can remember, and it's devotees are strong in both number and ferocity.  Now, the pizza here is good, don't get me wrong.  It's an authentic, made-just-for-you, pie of yuminess.  However, the pizza isn't what gets people about this place, it's the pizza's accompaniment:  the wings.  Johnny Mac hails from Buffalo and brought his special secret recipe with him when he migrated here.  Many people claim these wings are the best in the valley and I would have to agree with them.

Best service. Best wings. We come back here time and again. My kids request this place for pizza and wings when we ask them where they want to go. Every time we come back the service gets better and better. This place is a hidden gem and will not disappoint. Great atmosphere for the adults too!

Awesome hole in the whole! Totally deceiving and rewarding! Food and menu is excellent! Service is solid, and staff is fantastic! Greeted at the door by multiple staff members! Highly recommend! Perfect for lunch, but can't wait to try some past or pizza for dinner!

Guess I struck out, yet again. I was really hankering for some of that watermelon bbq sauce I heard so much about. Last weekend I was in the area and decided to try some watermelon BBQ sauce wings. They charged me almost 12$ for a pound of wings which i thought was a little steep , but i thought they better be worth it. I waited 5 mins or so to even have someone help me. One of the servers was having it out with the cook , some F bombs were dropped I thought geeze save it for montel, don't leave the dirty laundry out when there's patrons at the counter. Finally some lady said oh are you waiting to order food? I thought No i just like to stare blankly at menu boards, because I don't have cable. I Placed my order waited 10 mins or so for the wings and go them to go. Arrived at my destination to enjoy some high dollar wings and was sadly disappointing. The watermelon BBQ sauce was not very tangy and rather bland. I have had better elsewhere, perhaps there main dishes are more appealing. For the price I wasn't too pleased.

Came with a friend a couple days ago to watch the game not really expecting much, but I was pleasantly surprised.   At the beginning of the game, there was a couple of open seats at the bar, but by the end of the game the place was more or less full and everyone was having a great time. We ordered typical bar food, pizza and some wings, which was great and even though the bartender was swamped she never totally forgot about us which was also nice.   All in all it was a typical local's bar with good food.  I wouldn't hesitate coming in for another game.
Came for the highly touted BBQ watermelon sauce but really enjoyed the pizza.  Even though we live about 40 minutes away this is going to become a monthly visit for the wife and I.

I love this place first off cause there is no smoking inside. I'm not a fan of my meal being ruined by someone's cigarette smoke blowing in my face. Speaking of meals, the food is delicious. Well I've only tried the pizza and the wings. My name is Jacob and I'm addicted to the twice baked hot wings! No dipping sauce needed, ranch and blue cheese only get in the way. Nicole, Christine, and I believe it's Lou perhaps Luke have excellent customer service skills. The ambience is excellent as well, with all the TVs there isn't a bad spot to catch the game. Thanks Johnny Mac's for representing Henderson the right way!

Hands down the best hot wings in town. I have tried wings at several places around the valley and Johnny Mac's double baked hot wings are the best. The crispy outside and the tender meat inside complements the NY style pizza's very well. I often do the Henderson and Small Henderson specials as my go-to.
$12 for a tiny Beef on Weck sandwich and fries... $11 for a pound of wings (that's about 7 wings)...$18.25 for a large cheese and pepperoni pizza... Overpriced bar food to say the least.

I have been coming here since I was in High School. Always ordering "THE BIG VIN". My all time favorite... but they recently changed the buns to these thick buns which make it taste like all bread and really dry:(  I mean each bun must be over and inch thick I could barely get my mouth  around it please go back to the old buns ! I could always count on that sandwich to deliver ..

If you like wings, you'll love theirs.  Had the scorching wings double baked (baked, then fried I think)...all I know is they come out crispy and delicious.  Great flavor, good heat.   The fries however, need some help - over cooked, no salt, tasteless...but will be back for more wings.

On a recent trip to Henderson, Nevada for work, I stopped by this restaurant at the suggestion of several locals.  The restaurant was started by a former New Yorker, and the walls have a few autographed New York Yankee jerseys on them. The wait staff was super friendly and very accommodating.  I ordered the Pink Vodka Raviolis.  It was just enough for lunch, light, and very flavorful.    Definitely a place worth checking out.

This place knows how to make a pizza. Perfect amount of sauce and toppings.  The Fettuccini Alfredo, leaves something to be desired. I don't know what it was about it, but it just wasn't what I expected.  Busy on a Friday night (to be expected at a restaurant / Bar), but very accommodating when I wanted to change my Dine in request to a To Go order.
best wings & pizza in henderson!! must have, travel hrs if you have to!!

I hate to have to give Johnny Mac's a bad review on their pizza...but...truth is truth.  The last 3 out of 4 pizza's have been so so bad....that we couldn't even eat them.  The first one was great!  But this last one....wow...it was absolutely disgusting.  It was so greasy, soggy & the toppings were horrid (Johnny Mac's special pizza)!  I have no idea why they refuse to put something under their pizzas to prevent them from turning into gross rubber.  And I have no idea if they ran out of toppings....but the toppings tasted like something from a dollar store.  I'm not even joking.  You could put a piece of "pepperoni" in your mouth ...with you eyes closed...and you would never be able to recognize that it was pepperoni.  It was that gross!  I wish Johnny could supervise his kitchen "cooks" alot better.  You spend almost $30 on a pizza....and can't even eat it.  But...on a lighter note.....the fish and chips is pretty darn good.  As long as they make the fish fresh.  It's a hit & miss.  I had it where you could clearly tell the fish was sitting for a while pre-cooked before we got it at our table...because it was barely luke warm & a bit  spongey.  But another time we got it...it was so hot...you had to wait a minute to even eat it....and it was hot & fresh!  Spaghetti & meatballs is pretty good as well.....as long as you tell them Do not break the pasta up.  But beware of the 2 for 1 Spaghetti special.  You really get one spaghetti dinner that they split in half.  The portion size looks like it's for a child. That was disappointing.  The next time we ordered it to go....it was the same thing....so we asked the lead cook if this is what it's supposed to look like...and he said absolutely not!  And he remade our order to go & it was like night & day!  So that time turned out well.  Meatballs are excellent!  I've given up on the pizza.  I won't try that again....so the fish on Fridays will have to do!

Being new to the area, we were on a mission to find a place that had great chicken wings. Johnny Mac's was recommended, so we decided to give it a shot tonight....big mistake. We were immediately seated and our drink order was taken by, who I thought was our server. When our drinks arrived, she offered appetizers, but we said no, we needed more time to look at the menu. About 15 minutes of waiting for our server to come, some other guy came to took our order. We ordered 3lbs of chicken wings with 3 different flavors. We were impressed on how good the wings were, I was happy that I had finally found "my wing place". That feeling quickly went away with the type of service we received. It was horrible. The guy who took our order and brought it out, never came back to check on us or to see if we needed another round. We were totally forgotten about. Finally the girl who took our drink order came to us and asked if we needed anything, she could tell from our facial expressions that we were pretty upset, we told her we just wanted our check.
