My boyfriend called it when he said it was going to take longer than 5 min to get our check! I was ready just to walk out without paying. Needless to say, the food was good, but the service was bad so we won't be back.

Holy HOT WINGS! WOW! Total surprise. We were not expecting much from this local dive but were shocked at the pizza and wings. Double baked and finished in a wood-fired pizza oven. You have to try the best wings in town. We will never go to Buffalo Wild Wings again.

Living in Henderson for 9 years now I have learned there are two sides to the city.  Green Valley and Old Henderson, and rarely do you need to venture to the other side.  In this case, because of Yelp, we took the drive to visit this place.  All the reviews below are accurate.  Its a great place to eat and take kids.  There is zero smoke in the air, the food is great, and kids can be loud.  The wings are some of the best I have ever had.  Full of meat and cooked perfectly.  What really surprised me was the panini.  We had a philly-steak and it was awesome.  Nicely cooked with plenty of flavor.  They serve Stella Artois  the exact way you should.  My kids loved the pizza and the other table's pies looked great.  The atmosphere reminded me of the great pubs back in the mid-west.  I would easily go back.
First time dinning in and the family loved it. There's a recipe for make good bar food and this place has a copy. Good wings, good drinks and a friendly staff. A+ on my book.

We ended up leaving another pizza spot because the service was terrible and ended up here on a whim. It was delicious! Great pizza and ordered the hot wings which were good and crispy! Great service. The place was packed and we had at least three people stop by to check on us. Glad we found this place... might be a good spot for football season!
Place is fantastic, love their specials. Really recommend the wings and pizza! Staff is very friendly! It's a far drive from were we live but willing to do it!! Keep it up guys!
A Henderson favorite.  We have been going here for years. Went in when they reopened after the remodel.  It was a good as ever! The barstaff always rocks it. Best pizza and wings in Hendo
Fish and chips (Friday nights) was pretty tasty. Onion rings were great. The onions stay the rings when you bite them How do they do that? The cannoli were also delicious.
So I've been told over and over that I have got to try this place. I came I ate and I enjoyed.

I love this place and i have been going for 20 plus years. I always get the same thing and love their pizza, double baked wings and chicken sandwich! I really wish you they took reservations or expanded their waiting area, it's always super crowded. I will still be a loyal customer i just wished some other things changed with their expansion.

Stopped in tonight from a friends recommendation. From the outside it doesn't look like much but on the inside is a nice sports bar meets small Italian booth style restaurant. Today was half price pizza day so we ordered that and it was really good as well as the service!

After months of fixing up the restaurant, the new Johnny Mac's doesn't appear much bigger than the old, but it looks good inside.  Food is still good.  The only downfall is the friendliness of those that work there.  Standing with my family as we wait to be seated, at least, five people looked at us and kept walking.  Servers don't smile and aren't as friendly as they once were.  Still worth going.

What that saying, never let a woman decide whats for lunch?    For me it's not a bad thing, because  if I"m taking one of my best friends out to lunch, and I let her decide...it's usually here.        Because it's not a date, so I can be a cheap ass bastard, and  jump  on my computer before we head out to this place, because Johnny Mac always has a restaurant.com certificate.  Johnny Mac is a sport bar / family restaurant / pizza joint rolled up into one, and has been a Henderson institution for the past +20 years, and my friend believe this place makes the best chicken wings and fingers in Las Vegas.     I really can't fight her on this one.   The owners are from Buffalo, NY, and prides themselves on using a fresh and never frozen chicken that soaked overnight in Buttermilk for their family recipe.  Warning:   don't order the viper hot!   you won't be able to taste anything after the first bite.  Yes, there's a bunch of sauces for the chicken, and the mild and watermelon bbq is pretty killer with these fingers.    The Fries are doubled fried, and has a nice snap to them.  Also, I love their Pizza, but tell them to bake it a little longer.    Their sauce is pretty killer, but just remember this pizza can get a little greasy.   So ask for extra napkins     This place is kind of dark inside, but service is very good, and there a bunch of LCD monitors throughout the establishment.     BTW, this place is a Buffalo Bill hangout during the NFL season, and have pretty good Sunday buffet during game time.  If you're from Buffalo, and getting a little homesick...you might want to check this place out.   One more thing, get a few doughtnut from Friendly (which is a few doors away from them)
Yummy! Just flat worth it! Customer service and food A+ We always get 1 of his sons.. Upon request if possible. If not they are all good. It's addicting beware!!

Friend recommend this place to me over a year ago and I love it. It's a small bar in Henderson. Best pizza in town I think. Always packed but I've always have great service. The owner or manager comes out once on a while and ask how everything is. Bartenders are really nice, chit chatting with everyone.

Hands down...the best burger in Henderson. Period. End of story. The Village burger is everything you could ever want and hope for. For reals. The meat is cooked to perfection, the bun is soft but doesn't fall apart on you and it comes with not 1, but 2! kinds of cheese. I think the kicker, however, is the vinaigrette they put on it. It's not overwhelming but gives the burger the most amazing flavor. The fries are run of the mill restaurant fries but the burger is so incredible!   Families shouldn't be turned off by the bar aspect of Johnny Macs. They have a large restaurant area that's fine for families. Lots of TVs to watch and the employees are kind, professional and quick. We had a pretty large party-7 people-but the food came out pretty fast, especially for a Saturday night.   I'll be back to Johnny Macs again and again. And again. And again. The Village burger is calling my name. I love it. I really, really love it!

I was somewhat excited to try the food here based on the ratings. We (wife and kid) came on a Sat lunch. The restaurant was getting full but we were seated quickly. Friendly staff. Ordered a pizza special, antipasto salad, and 2 kinds of wings. The salad had no value for the $12 price tag, was no frills and not memorable. Pizza and wings came up next. Pizza "looked" great as they really brown the cheese. Sadly, it was like bread with toppings. Really soggy and lacked flavor. Serving it on a pan lined with tissue paper certainly does not help. It was also a pre-made shell so if this is something you hate like I do, don't order the pizza unless you are a huge frozen pizza fan because this was similar. The wings came in 2 flavors, one order was just cooked hot, the other was not. I'm not sure how that went down in the kitchen, but I did not feel like sending it back. Total bill was in the $70's I had one beer and a soft drink. I'll come back for a drink and the bar atmosphere, but won't be getting my pizza and wing fix here.
I used to love this restaurant. I don't know what's happened over the years but it's really just not worth it to me anymore.

We live very close to here and have been wanting to try it for about 6 months now. First impression: the place was packed! Good sign. The menu is pretty varied which is nice. I tried the pasta with basil and a marinara-white wine sauce. Very tasty. I also tried the fried zucchini which was good but I compare all fried zucchini to farmer boys so thought it was just ok. My husband liked his ranch bacon cheeseburger. The pizza was a hit with everyone else. We were unsure of whether or not it would be family friendly since on the outside it seems more bar-ish but there were tons of families in there on a Saturday evening. Perhaps it gets a little more adulty in the late evening. Overall, cool place and we will be back.

OUTSTANDING.    Reason 1 -- The owner doesn't allow smoking  If you want to go to a sports bar in Las Vegas, you pretty much have to surrender to the fact that you will be breathing in "lowlife trash gas" a.k.a. cigarette smoke.    Johnny Macs is the only sports bar in the Vegas area (that I know of) that does not allow smoking.    For that reason, it is a sports bar where people bring their kids.  It is nice to go watch a game with the whole family, and not feel like you're giving your kids cancer or feel like you need a shower after you are done.    Reason 2 -- the food  I am not from Buffalo, but my wife is.  So is the owner.  They bring in Beef on Weck, YUM.  The wings impress even the most hard core Buffalonians.  The ribs are outstanding too.  Everything I have eaten there was either off-the-charts delicious, or at least good enough (the antipasto salad, for example, is something that you really can't improve on -- it is what it is).    Reason 3 -- The Service  Every time I have been there, the staff has been attentive without being annoying.  Every time, the owner comes by at least once to make sure that you're happy with your food and your service.  This has happened to me whether it was a slow Monday night or a super-busy Sunday afternoon when the Bills are playing.  Reason 4 -- GREAT place to watch a game.  First off, if you hate the Buffalo Bills, stay out of this place.  This is a shrine to the Bills, and you better be ready to tolerate it.  I am a die hard New England Patriots fan, and I've never felt unwelcome in the place -- even when wearing my Steve Grogan jersey.  Even watching the Bills play the Patriots, people were cool.  But, if I were a Bills fan, I'd be here every sunday.  Even a non-Bills fan will enjoy it though.    All in all, this is a great sports bar, where you can bring your family or just come on your own.  I could not recommend it more highly.

Great place to eat.  I love the pizza and wings deals.  The pizza is some of the best I have had, but I had to take away one star because my husband and my oldest daughter witnessed the guy making pizzas in the back eating pepperoni as he was adding some to a pizza he was preparing.  Yuck!

Years of coming to/ordering from Johnny, I sadly report their food quality has dropped. The antipasto salad,my favorite, now is horrible.  An expensive salad which use to be worth the price. Look at the following picture taking after I arrived home.

It's cheers!!!! I've been coming here since they were new ( so was I) . I have never had pizza and fingers that compare . The best!!!!!! And it's quaint, and friendly. I only make it out to this neck of the woods about once per year now. But whenever I do... This is a MUST

I love Johnny Mac's. But.....they need to be clear on their wing portions. Last time I was there I ordered 3 lbs of wings for my table which stated 24-28 wings. When they brought the wings out it was about 16 wings which is what is stated in the 2lbs. So, be careful. Mr. Mac is getting a little tight on his products. But, the food is amazing.

My family and I really love the food!! The pizza & wings are our favorites. Service is always exceptional.  Nice atmosphere, clean & friendly.  I have recommended Johnny Macs to my friends and they have always enjoyed the food!  No complaints.  If your  in the mood for some great pizza and wings then Johnny Macs is the place to go!!! Salad & pasta very tasty as well!!  All the food I have eaten at Johnny Macs has been good!! Try it for yourself!

O. M. G. Recommend by a friend, we stopped here on our way home from checking on the house build. As we will soon be Hendersonians, we are looking for quality places close to the house. This may be the only place we ever go from here in out. And if you follow me at all, you know that's saying a lot cuz I LOVE me some Boulder City food, and this place could keep me in Henderson to eat. I devoured the Roast Beef on Wreck sandwich (think: the best French Dip you've ever had). Absolutely delicious. Huge portion of beef on an amazing bun. I've been told they bring the bread in from New York directly. It was amazing. I'm going to have a really hard time ordering anything else in the menu. My wife is quite the Wings snob and she absolutely loved them. She orders a pound, 1/2 Lemon Pepper and 1/2 Teriyaki. She does not like spice at all and these were perfect. She liked the Lemon Pepper over the Teriyaki. We were here in a night they happened to have Crab Cakes. Now, again, if you follow me at all, you know we are Crab Cake snobs. I've learned that you don't expect much at all from CC's in a bar, but try them we must. They. Are. Stellar!!! Tons of crab meat, and awesome flavoring. Pretty much the best we've had in Vegas, period. Apparently they fly the crab in from the East Coast and don't always have them on the menu so if they do, order them. You won't be disappointed. Pretty good selection of craft brew, they had multiple IPA's which is my wheelhouse so I was happy. No Riesling or Moscato in the wine department. It'd be nice if they added one of those. The service here was top notch, and they were pretty busy. We were really impressed by the service. We are super excited to have found this place. If it weren't Super Bowl Sunday tomorrow, we'd probably be going back. Can't wait to try the burgers and pizza!!! See y'all soon J'Mac's!!

We have lived by this place for three years and always talk about trying it and finally we did. I really wanted to try the watermelon bbq wings but they were out. Bummer! I had the garlic cilantro wings and onion rings. Which were yummy! Our server was awesome too! We will definitely be back!

Great little find. Went here for a late dinner after my son's speech and debate competition (restaurant was close by the high school).    The place was full and felt alive. Felt very cozy. The environment reminded me of four kegs back in the 80's.   We had a large pizza and 5 lbs of chicken wings. Very very good. There were 4 adults and 1 child and we still had a lot of left overs.   The food was excellent and our waiter was super fast and courteous.  We will come back for sure with friends!!  Would be a great place to eat and watch a game.   As we left the restaurant an overwhelming smell of donuts hit us like a ton of bricks. Went 3 doors down and ate donuts  at 930 for dessert. OMG so good  GREAT evening!!!!

This place has some of the best pizza I have had anywhere.  I get pizza from here at least 2-3 times a month.  Wow!  If you dine in on Wednesdays, there's even a special price for it.  I've also had other stuff from the menu but I keep going back for the pizza!  Great place and I plan to keep coming back again and again!
Literally the best freaking wings I've ever tried! The waiters are super nice and the price for wings are very good! Love eating at Johnny macs!

First time here, and the service was bad, they forgot to put our Oder in and that's only because we asked if it would be ready soon, this was 40 min later, never once came to our table to see if we needed refills or if everything was okay, never again will I come here
Best Cajun Burger ever. Onion rings are also off the hook!! Highly recommend.  Wait staff and bar tenders are awesome. Super cool vibe and clean :)

This place is just amazing!  This bar is so friendly and the staff are amazingly awsome, I'm deffinently coming here again and I love the Yankees not my number one but my number two lol, the food tastes great and they have so many televisions to watch sports on them, they have bmx, nascar, baseball, football, etc. And nascar is deffinently one of my favorite sports go truex jr. The dining experience is amazing and they always check on you to make sure everything's fine just like it should be in my opinion, there dining area is very clean and it's amazing there dishes are clean as well which is points in my book lol, awsome experience and would recommend to anyone who loves sports as well.

This place is constantly good, so had to write review.  Best customer service,  very comfortable inside,  amazing pizza and great prices happy hour drinks! I love this place for adults, kids, out of town guests!

We are "California" grown and here for a trip on Lake Mead and we're looking for a good place to eat close to Lake Las Vegas. We went by the Yelp reviews and it was worth the chance we took. The owner personally greeted us as did his son. We had the famous wings and they did not disappoint! We followed the wings with hamburger and sandwiches with onion rings and French fries. Great food and great family owned business- highly recommend!

Ohhhh mmmm geeeeee!   Delish!!  Great atmosphere and the service very friendly!   Definitely a local hangout and for good reason!   Totally devoured the wings and the heat was just right.  Shared the Johnmy Mac special pizza.   Hot, cheesy and perfect.  Top that with a brownie topped with ice cream and this is magical!   You better find time to visit Johnmy Mac's!  Henderson's best local hangout.

We've been coming to Johnny Mac's for years, and it is consistently a great place with great food and awesome service. They always seem busy and there's usually a wait time, but we've always been seated faster than the stated wait time. The servers are all very friendly and take good care of their customers. You can't beat their 1/2 price pizza on Wednesdays and my teen daughter loves their club sandwiches. The burgers are big and the servings are always more than enough. Great leftovers! Johnny runs a tight ship, and has lots of very loyal customers. The recent remodel really opens up the place! Well done!

I've been here twice and both times my order has been perfect hot and delicious! The first time, my fiancé and I had their cheese ravioli and a bbq bacon ranch burger. Their fries are so amazingly light and fluffy without a taste of oil! Just an hour ago we had their 3 cheese pizza. The mozzarella cheese was thick and stringy, ricotta was placed almost like tiny balls in a topping fashion. I would seriously recommend their ravioli. Over the top flavor with their sauce!

If I lived anywhere near this neighborhood, this would be my haunt.  Went in with a friend for pizza, wings, and beer.  We ordered the little henderson special - a one-topping pizza and 2 lbs of wings for $29. First the wings.  I don't even really like wings, but my friend insisted.  Friggin' yum.  Cooked perfectly - I had the hot with the hottest sauce on the side - these are hands-down the best wings I have ever had.  And the hottest sauce was incredibly intense YET tasty.  Pizza gets high marks, too - perfect crust and sauce, and the edges of the pepperoni were crispy, just the way I like it.  The only bummer was a disappointing beer selection, but I settled for a Sam Adams.

This place is a sports bar / restaurant / family restaurant. It's hard for a place like this to stand out when there are so many similar such businesses littered throughout clark county. I would say however that most of them don't have the family restaurant aspect-- it was full of familes with their kids. I would also say that most of them don't serve food as good as this place does.  Twenty six plus years in the restaurant business and it shows. Definitely the best pizza I have ever tasted in any sports-bar/bar establishment.  I guess they make their own dough daily. We were a group of six so we decided the Henderson special was the best way to go. It ended up being a very affordable deal and we still had left over wings. We tried mild, bbq, and scorching hot. The scorching hot sauce was fantastic-- spicy enough to burn but also offering some other tangy flavors-- they clearly make it themselves. They also make their own bbq sauce --which turned out to be the best bbq sauce I have ever tasted. I eat at buffalo wild wings quite often and can easily say that these wings are miles above those of the corporate competitors. The next time there is a sports game I will insist to my friends that we watch it here.

Great pizza but wings were average.  Ordered at bar while I had a beer and bartender was very friendly and handled a full bar like a champ finding a couple seconds to make short talk with us.  We will be returning soon!,

Trekked to Henderson last night and this pilgrimage was to convert my girlfriend to the artery clogging goodness of these Johnnie Mac Wings. She's been converted. Oh, the flavors are medium, hot, and firey suicide. I had the firey suicide on the side and it wasn't suicidal for me it was spicy hot but tasty, my eyes were teary and the nose was runny after a few. The staff is genuinely nice and expedient.

This is the best local food joint around.  Weds. night half price pizza is the best.  My favorite is the lemon pepper wings. I love this place and we take all of our out of town guests there and when they return, they want to go back.
Best locals place in town! They remodeled and it's amazing looks awesome food is as good as ever and the service is amazing! Great atmosphere!

Have been here many times...and never had a bad wing.  Their garlic cilantro sauce is worth driving from the other side of town for!  It's a non-smoking bar and restaurant where kids are welcome.  Pizza is decent and the tv's provide an awesome atmosphere for sporting events.  Service can be slow but be reasonable! This place is always packed.

Came in solo to catch the Thursday night football game while I was in town for work. All the employees I encountered were friendly and attentive. The place had a nice welcoming feel and plenty of TVs plus a decent selection of beers on tap. The bartender made me one of his award winning bloody marys, which was bold in flavor yet light in texture and just so delicious! Can't really comment on their food, I only had a salad & potato wedges but they were both great. Pretty cool place!

I'm sitting in this restaurant now and I have to say it might be the worst experience I've had in quite a long time. I've been here for 45 minutes it took 10 mins to take a drink order and another 5 to order our food even though we said we were ready to order. We ordered an appetizer that we cancelled after 39 mins they brought it "out on the house" and it was the wrong thing. It's now been another 15 mins and I am contemplating walking out. I can say I will never be back to Johnny Macs.

A bar where everybody knows your name!  I'm not a regular here, it was my first time stopping by, but you can tell this is a local place and the regulars keep coming back.  We were greeted, got seated right away and served waters and menus. We had just missed the Buffalo Bills crowd for the big game as this is a Bills bar. Apparently it's standing room only during those games so I'm sure that's a great time too!  We ordered their fabulous hot buffalo wings and the white pizza.  The wings come in pound increments of 1,2,3 and 5 pounds with 8-10 wings per pound. The wings were amazing! Flavorful, spicy, buttery with tons of sauce and a homemade blue cheese dip.   We ordered a 12 inch pizza that has tons of roasted artichokes, roasted red peppers, garlic, tomatoes and large amounts of cheese. The crust was  perfect balance of chewy and crunchy ends.  They have daily specials, one of their most popular is the beef on weck which I'll have to try next time.   The servers were constantly checking on us and several different ones came by to clear our plates, grab us another round and box our food.   We appreciated everyone's hospitality and the delicious food!

As soon as we walked in, awesome smelling food filled the air. They staff was friendly and the food was really good! The vibe was relaxing and a great local place to chill, have a beer, and kick back. Would definitely recommend checking it out.

We hit up this place after getting some Frost Bites(Nothing wrong with dessert before dinner, right?)   It doesn't look like anything from the outside, but when you enter, this place is JUMPIN! at least it was when we visited. Hostesses kindly greet you at the door, and by the looks of it, there seemed to be at least 80% (maybe 90) of Hendersonian regulars that hardly ever venture out of Hendertucky if they don't have to.  Family owned and operated, they are out of Buffalo, NY....Birthplace of the Buffalo Wings and have been a Henderson institution for over 20+ years. The plethora of menu items here are unbelieveable, but we came for two of their specialities-Pizza and Wings.  The Pizza was good, but a bit greasy, and the wings....they were just okay, I guess my expectations were higher after hearing that they were from Buffalo. Oh well...The Watermelon BBQ sauce was tasty and the service was great, so maybe we'll give Johnny Mac's another try....maybe...ALOHA!!!

I love this place they might have the best pizza in town. I live 40 miles from this restaurant and I work 20 miles from it, but about once every couple of months I drive down there with my girlfriend just for the pizza. And the ribs are very good. With the watermelon sauce they have some of the most unique flavor you'll ever experience on ribs. I I loathe bleu cheese dressing, but this place makes the only blue cheese dressing in the world that I will actually eat and enjoy. It gets 5 Stars purely for the food. Other than that it's just a bar with a lot of TVs. It's clean, the staff is nice, but it's just a bar.

Consistency, is the best way to describe JMacs.   Just completely redone with a much larger bar and high table area.  Wings and pizza will have you coming back for sure (as well as looking into Lipitor) Burgers are legit.  The Big Vin (sausage sandwich) is on the level of selling a kidney for!!
These reviews MUST be from friends and family, The pizza tastes like NOTHING...No flavor at all...Wings were ok, but this place will never see my family again....waste of money...

Very good place. Good customer service greeted when we walked in. Food is good pizza is very very good chicken wings were okay but everything is piping hot fresh love it. The bathroom very nice & really clean.

The Server was nice... The wait for our food was Horribly long... They said their kitchen was backed up for some reason... Kept saying your food will be out shortly... When we finally got our food, The pizza was good... The wings were supposed to be Mild but, tasted blah, no sauce at all... I come to Henderson often, don't think I will be eating here anymore...

Went to Johnny Mac's for the first time yesterday after my husband raved about it. I love pizza so of course that is what we ordered along with wings (hot), fries and homemade garlic bread. I am not a wings person so I didnt try them but they definitely smelled hot! The fries were good (shoestring). The pizza was ok...I wouldnt go back just for the pizza. We had a party of 10 and did receive decent service. They include gratuity in the bill which was fine. All and all...I live in the aliante area and will not be traveling all the way over here just to have lunch or dinner. It was just OK.
Really good pizza. Love to go on Wednesday nights and get it 1/2 off. Wings are good too.  It's a NY bar, so that makes it better ;)
Picked up the Henderson special 2 weekends in a row. Wings are too dry and pizza is too thick. The place is just ok!
Just ordered delivery 2lbs of chicken with deep fried zuchinnis and they're all burnt. We called and they won't refund or deliver fresh ones. What kind of customer service is this?

The good: the food is awesome, it's a great little neighborhood bar. We've never had a bad meal, and you can't go wrong with the 2 slices of pizza and a drink for $6.99.   The bad: we have been here on two occasions where the service has been awful--both times we had the same waiter named Andrew. We had to wait 10 minutes before flagging down a waitress to get us another beer after our glasses had been sitting empty. Even after we asked the waitress for another beer she let Andrew know that we were out of drinks. Another five minutes passed before she came back and asked if we had gotten our beers. He dropped off a beer without a word five minutes later. So a total of 20 minutes passed with our glasses empty. We watched as the rest of the staff hustled around helping other tables as we waiting for our check, and Andrew was no where to be found. One of the other waitresses even gave us sympathetic looks and went to go get Andrew for us.  This is the second time we've had Andrew, and the second time we were left disappointed.   Overall: We will go back, because the food is awesome and the staff with the exception of Andrew is great.

Wife and I enjoy this place very much. When family is in town this is a usual place to take them. At the most we come here once a month. Only once or twice we've had to wait for more the 15-20 minutes. We usually opt for the Henderson Special(wings and pizza) so we'll have leftovers then finish off the meal with their cannoli dessert. If we're not wanting to deal with the crowd or a wait we'll call it in for a pickup and take it home.  As far as their wings go I love their watermelon and my wife goes with the mild. By comparison of other wing places in the area this would be our favorite but that's just us.  If we're going to a friends house for dinner and we're tasked for bringing dessert we always get cannoli's to-go. It's never failed us yet, they're so good!  Their Thursday night special 2 for 1 spaghetti and meatballs is pretty good. We've done this a few times when we're not in the mood to cook.

Food is good but not worth the extra dollar they try to charge! It happened to me and several other yelpers! Their menu isn't exactly cheap to begin with for bar food.   The food is greasy but delicious better-than-average bar food. The burger buns are huge and delicious. Service is hit & miss... usually mediocre.   This place could be really be good if they could get it together. As it is now you're taking your chances going in... so good luck!!
Great food for a reasonable price, suggest you get there early as there is a long wait during the dinner rush but it's totally worth it.

Food is popular and well known in the little town of Henderson. Service is horrible. Worst Ive seen, probably ever. Place is always packed to the walls busy, regardless of the horrible staff. They do deliver though, so If you want to try the food, (it's "Henderson good",  not rave-worthy) order some delivery.

Busy night, employees were talking about customers right in front of waiting customers. Attempted to talk to 4 different employees and Couldn't get anyones attention for 10 minutes to put my name down for a table. As I was trying to get someone's attention a woman walked in and immediately got acknowledged, I left. Don't think I will be returning.

We had heard about this place from a friend of mine's nephew who works there and told us to come check it out. This was back in December of 2012 and we just never got around to it. Then a few days ago we were talking about going out there to try it, but had forgotten the name! Literally the very next day we were out running errands in the area and were looking for a place to eat, so I hopped on Yelp and started finding something with good reviews that was relatively close. Saw the name and recognized that it was the place we were just talking about the day earlier! So we popped in! My husband had a burger and onion rings and loved it! I had the grilled chicken sandwich and it was to die for! I am not a big burger fan, but my husband is so it's nice that we have found a place that has a lot of options and a good burger!  To top it off the service was fantastic! Every waiter/tress in our area plus others checked on us many times and the food came out quickly.

Finally found a good beef on weck!  That and a real fish fry are what we miss most about our Western N Y roots. Finally found it at this Henderson strip mall. We thought it was very good.  Plied high on a kimmelweck roll, salty with caraway seeds!

Johnny Mac's is a strip mall restaurant/bar one could drive by without even noticing- but you should take notice.  Most of the items we've had at Johnny Mac's have been fantastic and reasonably priced.  Another thing that makes this place is great is that it's smoke free.  Believe me, when you first walk in, you expect a cloud of smoke.  If you're going for draft beer, consider the $10.50 pitcher to share.  It is a good deal and priced better than buying individual pints.  Tonight we had the Beef on Weck special.  If you are not familiar with this Buffalo, NY specialty, it's thin cut roast beef on a toasted kimmelweck roll with a side of au jus.  Johnny's serves it with fries and a pickle.  I've now had this dish twice, and both times it was fantastic.  The meat could be a little rarer, but it is definitely tender and flavorful.  But, to me, this sandwich is all about the roll.  It makes the sandwich superb.  We also had the wings tonight, but they were out of the watermelon BBQ sauce I love and the wings were not crispy tonight.  I am not a fan of chewy skin on my wings, so I took a pass on the rest after one bite.  After coming for dinner multiple times and take out (pizza) a couple times, I would definitely recommend it to others and will be back.

Great pizza and beer. The Guinness pitcher of beer had a diffuser in the middle to prevent head. I feel like you get less beer because of this. Pizzas are flavorful and a great variety to choose from. Great place to sit at the bar drinking beer and watching sports on the television. Customer service is friendly with a smile. Finally tried the watermelon BBQ chicken wings and was not impressed. Really lacked flavor, so I ordered a side order of sauce thinking that they didn't put enough on. No, it was the flavorless sauce. The extra sauce is an additional 50 cents. What a rip off. Also noticed that the noise level on a 1 to 10 scale was at an easy eight. So if you are meeting people to catch up on the old times, you will find yourself saying "WHAT" a lot. The onion rings have quite a bit of water inside, which sucks because the breading is good. With not much to choose from in this area, this place becomes a diamond in the ruff. Still has great pizza!

So last night, we went to try the fish fry. Btw, I've now been here 6 times in a month. I might have to move closer.   Anyway, it was very crowded being a Friday, but the wait wasn't unbearable. Especially with our high hopes. We ordered the fish fry and the 5 chicken strip dish with a cup of clam chowder to share. The chowder came first. Honestly, it was only okay. Not bad, but not as good as everything else. It detracted nothing though, so my rating stays the same. I was worried that the food quality would suffer as some restaurants tend to when they are that busy.  I worried for nothing! The fish fry came and hands down, kicks Crown & Anchor's sweet British arse. The batter was crisp, not overwhelming, and had excellent flavor. The fish was light, moist, and flaky. It was so fresh, no off-putting fishiness to be found. My bf loved it, and the portion was plenty.  The chicken "strips" if you can call them that, were enormous and so tasty. The white meat was fresh and moist. Again, they nailed the technique of battering and frying. Yumyumyum. We'll be back for Beef on Weck. Stay tuned!

I love this place. I had bad service once, but after coming back with my parents they had gotten it together. The food is always good, the drinks are fantastic and it has a homey comfy feel that really allows you to relax. I will be a forever customer.

Maybe, it was due to Black Friday, but my family's experience was less then great, in fact it barely measured up to good. Servise was slow and poorly organized. Most of my party received their drinks in a timley manner, however the beer we ordered took nearly a half hour to arrive. The french fries we.ordered arrived cold, room temperature is more accurate. The pizza was hot and just a tad undercooked but tasty. I am in Henderson several times a year and was hoping for a regular place to hang. I may have to keep looking.

I have to say I don't see what you other Yelpers are so happy about.  I have went there twice in the last 30 days and am very disappointed.  The first time I had the wings and they were nothing special. The buffalo sauce is just Franks Red Hot.  Today I ordered a burger and an Ice tea.  The burger was so so. Obviously a frozen package beef pattie, definitely not fresh, and the side of ranch for my fries was not homemade either. The thing that really blows me away is the prices!  About $14 for a burger, fries and an ice tea, are you f*n kidding me?  Service is just so so, and food is very generic, unthaw and serve.  So don't waste your money, go somewhere that understands the value of FRESH, NONFROZEN products, and doesn't overcharge you for freezerburn!
Best wings, fingers, and pizza you'll ever have. Food is always consistent and amazing
I love how close this place is to my home.  Good wings and the pizza looks really good.  My mother-in-law loved their mozzarella sticks, which they make in house.  :)

This is a great neighborhood bar with a very good vibe. Really nice staff and all are attentive and friendly. The infamous Johnny Mac is a great host and is on top of the action.  The food is the real star here. The fresh, never frozen wings are very meaty, fried perfectly crisp and flavorful. The portion is very generous for the price, providing an outstanding value and a memorable meal.  They just reopened after an extensive remodel. The new look is clean, upscale, inviting. While the bar and restaurant are packed there is a steady lineup of customers picking up carry out food. Obviously they know something about the food at Johnny Mac's!  I can't wait to come back and continue exploring the menu.

I was convinced by friends to give Johnny Mac's another shot... And I am really thankful I did!    Johnny Mac's was recently renovated, however I have only gotten to go orders since that occurred so my review will focus on that.    Maybe my initial visit was on an off day, the quality of the pizzas I have been getting over the last year from Johnny Mac's are leaps and bounds above the sad pie we were served back in 2011. I usually have special requests for my pizzas and they always get my food right here.   Pizzas here have an excellent sauce to cheese to topping ratio. Prices are a little higher than some of the other pizza spots in the area, and Johnny Mac's seems to be busy all day, every day so there can be longer-than-expected waits for picking up orders (and finding a spot to park can also be difficult at times) but overall, I am a fan of the renovated Johnny Mac's.    TIP: Half off pizzas on Wednesday, dine in only.

Awesome food and great sports bar atmosphere.  As Pittsburghers on vacation this June, we watched two of the games of the Stanley Cup final here.  Great place to watch sports.  Too loud for date nights, at least when we were there, but was still family friendly.

I've been going to Johnnys for around 20 years..  When you think of a " Buffalo bar " you think of great pizza and wings.  The pizza is waaaay better than a Pizza Hut or a Domino's. The Wings I think what makes Johnny Mac's a Buffalo Bar big plump amd delicious.  1 wing from here are 2 Wild Wings wing.   They even have great sandwiches they toast the bread and that makes them great.   Thanks for 30 years John!

Me and my family have been coming for over three years! You can't be the food here everything is great! Staff is super friendly! Recently remodeled and the henderson special is our go to!! You can't go wrong here!

Went on a Friday night, that was the first mistake. Even at 5:30 many people waiting for tables.  It was just my wife and I and we were told it would be 20 minutes.  After 40 minutes I ask the status and was told they had no idea how long it would take to be seated.  I saw others had the same issue.  It appears unless you want to sit at the bar or have a big group you should avoid this place.  Especially couples since in the 40 minutes we waited only one couple was seated .   I can't tell you if the food is any good since we never got seated so we left.

Oh goodness!! I don't even know where to start with this place!! I wish I could give it more stars!! The food is so delicious, we just have to keep coming back for more... We enjoy the bbq chicken wings, but really favor the pizza... They also have deep fried pickles, which to me is like heaven in breading... Lol The atmosphere is laid back and relaxed, with a nice homey feeling... The staff is so friendly, and they work as a team and you get taken care of by any one of them if you need anything... Tonight we had Andy as our server... He is spectacular and completely on point... There's nothing that we needed that he didn't provide within a few minutes of us requesting it!! I can say he's the best waiter I've had in a while... The bartender Luke is pretty awesome too... He greets us each time with a smile on his face and treats us as if he's known us for years... Everyone here is so nice, and I love the family feel!! There is not a single complaint that I could think of for this place!! We love it!! We will come back again and again!!

Used to go here weekly with family but NO more sadly. Tried again and left again for 3rd try. Was sat in nearly empty restaurant by one of college age gals who is always so nice and helpful. She is the hostess with blond curly hair in a pony tail who seems to be hostess, busser, phone answerer and drink server is only person to give us time of day. Her hospitality is why I give 1 star...Once she sat us took drink order and delivered drinks we were forgotten AGAIN by a brunette waitress who's usually there regularly. We waited 20 min and nobody took order. Really love food and wish it had better service but after another table seated after us was getting salads we decided why did we bother. Guess the owner doesn't care his locals are not coming anymore....business on a Saturday afternoon was bleak. Try hiring more people so least an order is taken. I enjoy a slow paced local spot to relax but after several attempts to give redemption entire family has removed Johnny macs from choices.

This is the local Henderson spot! If you don't know about this place your missing out. Forget the garbage chicken chain restaurant on Sunday. Great food absolutely amazing wings! I bring my kids in here from time to time on the weekdays when it's calmer. Weekends are packed get here early or your waiting. Beer and food selection is great the service could be better. I've always been treated good but I've waited for my check a time or two. All and all you can't go wrong here after a day on the boat.
Awesome food! Large portions, fast service, good prices. Tables have paper so the kids can draw all over the table, keeps them occupied.

Located in old Hendo, in a less than attractive location, the newly remodeled restaurant famous for pizza and wings was the spot chosen by my friend.  I had a grilled chicken sandwich with a side salad, she had a slice of cheese pizza and a salad.  Service was friendly, but they were a short a server so we waited quite awhile between visits.  The owner came over, super nice, even brought us refrills.  Lunch for 2 was $29.00. I'd go back again.

My husband was craving hot wings, and had this place in mind. He went with the easy decision this time and chose 'hot' for the wings, instead of trying one of their other flavors. I chose the chicken tender basket with fries.   It was fun in here, as it is a bar. Duh, yes I know that is in the title, but it has been awhile since I have been inside of an actual bar. Ha ha. As far at this place goes, the service was excellent, it was clean and everyone was friendly. I will definitely be back.  Wings were very good, and my husband was really happy with his choice. He already has another flavor in mind for when we return. I was not really a fan of the chicken tenders though. They were absolutely huge. Really thin and massive. They were very tender, which was great, but for the first few bites, I thought that I had been served fish n chips by mistake. Even the taste was similar. That was odd. The fries were hot and tasty though. Besides the tenders being oddly shaped/massive, their price is really high. I will not be ordering these again, even though tenders are some of my favorite things.    Wings though, yes.

I've been coming to Johnny Mac's almost since they opened back in the 80's. My daughter even worked here as a teen. So obviously I like the place. That is up until recently. The food and service has been hit and miss over the last year to year and a half. This is disappointing since this has been a great place to go over the last 30 years for Pizza, wings, sandwiches, burgers, etc. But over the last year+ I've had some bad food and on one occasion very poor service. And my recent order was very bad. Over the last year I have had the wrong order to go more than once, a Pizza that was not cooked fully and the cheese had slid off half the pizza and stuck to the box. I had to try and "fix" it and throw it in the oven for a few minutes. I stopped in at lunch once, sat at the bar with maybe two other patrons. The bar tender came over, talked around me to some people sitting at a table then left. Came back a few minutes later and did the same thing. Never asking me if I needed anything. Then left the bar and went and sat with the people for a few minutes. Came back behind the bar, walked right past me and still never said a word to me. I cashed out the couple of bucks I had in the machine and when he came over to pay me, he then asked me if I needed anything. I just said "no I'm good" and left. The last order I got was pizza and wings. The pizza was fine but the wings were absolutely horrible. My wife and I could not eat them they were so under cooked. One bite and spit out. I ended up having to put them in the oven under the broiler for 18 minutes. Have to be honest, they were really good after that. Now I say the pizza was good but unfortunately after having to cook the wings, the pizza was cold. So in the oven it went too. It has now become a place where I have second thoughts before I order. I think "boy I hope it's good this time". Never used to have to worry about that. They were always solid with really good food. I sincerely hope the owner, Johnny, takes a good look at his staff and their skills and tightens up the ship or he will lose a longtime customer. I'm giving them 3 starts based on history but they have been much less lately.

Not very impressed. I read so many great reviews on this place and always saw how busy they were so figured we'd give it a try. We were seated quickly which was a plus. Service was good, not great. Food was good but the description of the item apparently is not what it is. We bought the Bacon Pepper cheese burger. So figured it was a bacon burger with pepper jack cheese. The burger came and no bacon. I asked the waitress about it and she said it doesn't come with bacon. She did offer to get some but didn't want to be charged extra. We didn't have the Sunday menu to look at it again so we just left it alone. When we left, it definitely did have bacon on the description. Not sure if we'll be back

I was told of this place from a coworker. Skeptical at first but we shouldn't books by their cover. Got the Henderson special. Great deal. Have tried many times but could never finish it all...lol get the pizza extra crispy and the hot wings extra wet. The suicide sauce has great flavor. Good drinks and when you go friends it can be beat. Great atmosphere. Best pizza and wings in Vegas!!!!! Been here at least 5 times and will definitely be back!!!!!
Love love the wings at this place! Best place for a dinner on a Friday night with the kids pizza is awesome too!!
grew up eating johnny mac's ! best wings and beer in town. go see luke, matt and the rest of the awesome staff.

I went here to watch the College Football National Championship a couple weeks ago. (The game sucked, I don't understand how you can continue running a 3-4 defense all freaking game and allow the other team to run all over you. Apparently blitzing frequently is a foreign concept.)  First off the service was good, I had a medium pizza with Pepperoni,  Bacon,  & Canadian bacon because I like pizza. The pizza was good, so was the two rum and cokes I washed it down with. I had two slices left when it was all said and done.   I Def recommend this place, and going there. I also recommend you make the proper half time adjustments and stop a silly one dimensional team whose QB only average 20 passing attemtps a game from running the ball all over your butt.
We had pizza and twice bake bbq wings amazing!! Great atmosphere  they were very busy had a great special on spaghetti with meatballs 2 for 1 on Thursday's .. highly recommend

This is hands down the best chicken wings and pizza in town! Took my kids there and they loved it! A very family friendly place where you could also hang out with your friends shooting pool on a Friday night if you wanted to!

Good local little place.  Food is always amazing. Stopped once for a beer while ordering food and the bar is comfy and has slot machines if you like yo gamble or play a dollar to kill time. The staff is friendly and works fast. I usually order pizza wings or chicken strips im basic but its fresh and easy.

BEST PIZZA AROUND! I am an out of towner, but my parents live in the area and everytime I come and visit I always request we go here because the pizza is to die for! The service is great as well so you can't go wrong!

Excellent, Pizza delivered timely then crickets no server. After grabbing him as he passed bye non attentive we completed our dining without incident. The food was excellent and priced competitive. Almost a perfect 5 stars, maybe next visit?

Warm welcome for all New Yorkers.   Took me a few trips to get a solid review out of this place. My buddies are who initiated our first group outing here, so of course we enjoyed ourselves with some drinks from their full bar and watched football on the many TVs they have. It can get pretty busy during game days and weekends so be aware.  Our go to entree? The one and only Henderson Special! You can't go wrong splitting 5 Lbs. of Wings and a Large one Topping Pizza with 4 people. Or two people if your a fatty like me and the homie Christopher B. The best way is to have the wings double baked (try the watermelon flavor) and the pizza extra crispy.  Service is always on point as we never have to wave down the servers.

This place was a great find. Doesn't look like much from the front. Pretty classic sports bar setup inside. Lots of TVs, lots of ball games on.  What makes this place standout is the kitchen. Not just your typical sports bar fare. In addition to some huge burgers, the kitchen whips up some terrific pasta dishes and a whole lot more.  I had the Fettuccine Bolognese and it was as good as I've had at any Italian restaurant. We started off with some mozzarella sticks too. Not the typical ones that you get in a bar or a chain restaurant. These seemed like they had been breaded by hand.  Add to all of this very friendly staff. Definitely a spot I would come back to if here again.
Gonna make this short n sweet!   I had the best ribs I have ever had in my life!  My husband said that he had the best wings he has ever had in his life.   Enough said!  Go try it!

Thanks to Yelp found this awesome place! Food was FANTASTIC and the service was the best I've experienced anywhere in a very long time. Not just the waitress was great but when we were leaving we were told by at least 3 other employees to have a great day. So glad we searched out a local treasure in this city with lots of more commercial options... Totally worth it! Keep up the great work!

I am  originally from Buffalo, New York but have lived in Las Vegas for over 20 years and have been wanting to try this restaurant for years. Of course being from Buffalo I had to try the Buffalo wings. I ordered a dozen wings/ 1/2 order of cilantro garlic and 1/2 order of barbecue and a side of beer battered onion rings. The wings were outstanding meaty and very crispy and saucy the way I like them. They serve the wings Buffalo style with a side of celery and delicious blue cheese dressing. The generous side porton of onion rings were very crispy and coated with the perfect amount of batter.  Service was very friendly and even though the restaurant was packed my order came very quickly.. Prices were reasonable and included several pasta dishes, wings, pizza and other Buffalo specialties.  I enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere. I will be returning with friends and family and definitely want to come back during football season to watch the Bills game!  Great job Johnny Macs.. I felt like I was back home again!
Food was great service was fast and the server was very friendly and apologetic about the remodeling being done. I'll definitely go back

How does Johnny Mac's have 4 stars??  The lunch service lacked service.  Our waitress came to our table when we first sat down, but then we lost her to somewhere in the back for more than 30 minutes. After we finished eating, we wanted more cocktails, but nobody asked. The food was just "ok" and definitely not worth their prices! We then went to the bar to play and drink but again, no service. Bartenders need to check back and encourage the drinks and play to get customers to stay longer and spend money, right?!   Rumor has it there are amazing servers (namely Gemma), but today's service did not meet those expectations.   In addition, the women's restroom was out of seat covers and paper towels. When the staff was told, they said okay, but then it wasn't taken care of.    We won't be back to give this place another shot unless Gemma is working.

Staff was so friendly! We got the family pack with 5 pounds of wings and you can get five different flavors. (The hot is really hot). You also get a salad and a whole pizza with one topping, all for $45. It's a ton of food for a great deal. Pizza was delicious and wings were really juicy and had a lot of meat. Great place!!

I finally have tried this place out after numerous times of driving by and reading reviews. Let me say  NOT IMPRESSED. my first will be my last here. The place reminds me of a bar which is great but the vibes were off and I felt uncomfortable with my beautiful diverse family. The service was so poor we waited forever for our server to get us refills on numerous occations. We had finally put our order in and the order took well over 45 minutes to come to out table. The pizza was Meh nothing I would order again not even the plain cheese slice was good. We threw away half of a pizza which is not common for my family. The wings were OK honestly could have gone to BBW these were nothing special at all. Bland sauces and the chicken skin was super fatty and to get them crispy you have to pay extra. I won't go back.

I get into this place about three times annually. Last night, a Wednesday, was the worst experience I've ever had here. Wenesdays are "all you can eat pasta" and "half price pizza". I've never been here for this apparent extravaganza. As you can imagine, "all you can eat" meant people camped out at their tables until pasta was falling out of their ears. We arrived at 6 pm expecting a short wait as normal due to the popularity of this place. We were told 15 minute wait time...35 minutes later we were at a table! After placing our normal order of pizza and wings, we quickly learned they were either understaffed or just plain slow. The wings were delish...there is no medium sauce...it's mild or hot, and the hot have a good bite to them. There are other sauce flavors for the aristocrat in you, but Buffalo wings (to me) mean heat. The pizza was somehow different than my last visit many months ago. Maybe a crust change? It wasn't that great and seemed soggy towards the pizza center. Overall I was disappointed especially because it was 8 pm before we departed. This was totally because of the wait at the door and server response. Everyone is very hospitable and pleasant though which takes the edge off for us impatient types. I'll be back...just not on a Wednesday at dinner time!
Pure Awesomeness!!! We have officially found our new favorite place to eat out. The venue, the staff, the food all were AMAZING.

We saw this place while driving by and stopped in for lunch.  There was a sports bar atmosphere and they were fairly busy when we arrived.  The building is quite large with a lot of seating with accommodation for groups as well.  The staff was friendly and initially, they were attentive.  Our waitress was struggling to keep up with the tables and seemed to go missing for a bit near the end of our meal.  It took a while for her to come back and give us our check.  We ordered the special 2 for 1 spaghetti and meatballs along with some cowboy bites.  The bites were smaller than we expected and didn't last very long.  The spaghetti, on the other hand, was huge.  They served it in 2 plates with two meatballs on each plate and two slices of garlic bread.  The bread was pretty saturated with garlic butter and I didn't eat both pieces.  The spaghetti and meatballs tasted good and I wasn't able to eat all of my serving.  They have wings on the menu, but they are a bit pricey and you have to order a specific quantity that seemed like a lot for the two of us.  it would be good to find them on special.

Have to say I didn't use to like the food but now I have to say it's a favorite. I love the beef on weck they do on the weekends . They're caesar salad is a great portion. I like the pickle and zucchini spear apps . Could go on and on. And luanna is the best!

Been here 4 times in the last 3 weeks.  I'll start with the positive..  The atmosphere is laid back, fun and kid friendly, and I love the doors in the front that go up.  The food is mediocre though and the red wine is UGHHHH..  I've had pizza, pasta, chicken fingers, a panini, salad and a chicken burger.  None of the food is bad tasting but also nothing to write home about.. The kid menu I thought was reasonable but last 2 times I noticed on our receipt it's $1 more than whats posted, NOT COOL!  I think that's the case with some other items on the menu as well.  MR J Mac... Please update your menu prices as a courtesy to the folks that keep you in business.  The service has not been good.  The servers are friendly for sure which is part of why we keep going back but its slow and very inattentive.  I think this place has GREAT potential to be one of our go to places (maybe even replace Metro Pizza in our family nights out) but maybe they need a bit more staff.  Also one of my biggest annoyances about pizza, salad and wing places is not having homemade ranch..  The ranch here sucks!!  It can't be homemade.  We will go back since its a friendly local place and we really want to patronize these types of restaurants and businesses.

I've lived in Henderson for almost 7 years now and didn't try Johnny Mac's until recently. But after reading Shirley B's and Jessie B's reviews (Both of them have never given bad recommendations) my family and I decided to give them a try.   Parking: It's kinda crazy, and usually pretty busy as the Smith's store and the other shops close by generate quite a bit of traffic.   Service: 5 visits so far, all carryout orders. We've never been on hold more than 3 minutes when calling in an order. And when told orders will be ready in 15 min, they were ready in 15.   Decor: Johnny Mac's was recently remodeled but from the outside you won't see many changes. But step inside and you will notice the large bar with lots of HD flat screens, lots of tables and a clean decor that seems to be constantly busy. That being said it can get crowded at the front door if you're trying to get in to pick something up when they're busy and people are waiting for a table.   Food: We haven't tried their pizza yet but so far we've been happy with their sandwiches, wings, and pasta dishes. My son loves their spaghetti and this is one place that he never complains about if we order from them. Carryout orders also get doublechecked before they hand it over to you which is nice. It shows they care about what is leaving the kitchen.   Pricing: This is not the cheapest place to eat. Our carryout orders average $11 to $14 per person with no drinks. So if you eat in this could be a bit more expensive than you were expecting.   Overall I'm glad I followed Shirley B and Jessie B's advice and gave Johnny Mac's a try. We will be ordering from them again and if we ever get around to trying their pizza I'll update my review.
I love this place. Great food, good energy, and really great staff. It's a Very unique and low key place to eat or have a drink after work for locals or for visitors. Thanks guys!

Worst service ever. The hipster wannabe server stood there and wouldn't even make eye contact to seat us. After waiting 10 minutes, a girl finally offered to put us on a list. There was visibly 4-5 tables open at 7pm on a Sunday. At that point it was obvious they weren't capable of serving us so we said no thanks and left. Not even a apology. Pull your act together and drop the attitude. This is a local Henderson dive. Not some trendy restaurant on the strip. Won't be going here again!

We have been coming here for years whenever we need a pizza and wings fix.  We usually go with another couple and get the Henderson Special which is a large pizza and a pound of wings. We split the flavors on the wings and it is more than enough food for 4 people. What makes the wings special is they broast them. This gives them their signature crispiness. I myself hate slimy wings so this place is perfect for me.   The last few times I have gone I had noticed the wings weren't as crispy as they normally were (bordering on slimy-yuck). When I mentioned this to the server she said to just let them know when the order is placed that I want the wings extra crispy. Apparently there are different degrees of broasting.

Chef Keller took us here My family loved the wings  I ordered an amazing fabulous linguine clam sauce.  It was terrific  I was happy  A lot of sports fans, young servers.    It was near my home and packed. It's located my an amazing donut shop  Don't skip the donut shop  Parking may be tricky depending and sonetimes a wait  But I recommend

This is one of our family faves! We come to Johnny Macs every Sunday on our way back into town from our Lake House at Lake Mead. They have "hands down" the best chicken wings and my personal fave is their antipasto salad... A must try!  The staff is always so friendly and helpful! It is a Henderson gem as far as restaurants go...  They have a great bar if your going in with some friends or high / low top tables as well as booths if your enjoying a dinner with the family!  This is all around a super cool place for all occasions!

It's okay, a little pricey for amount you get, not super clean. Service is decent, I remember it being being better so maybe I'm bias? Food quality is ok, i got the corned beef special, not rememberable or remarkable. Should have got wings, but 24 for 16 to 20... I'd rather go to bdubs and get same amount for less.

I've been here twice, and my wife and I have only ordered burgers.  They are probably the best burgers I've had in the Las Vegas valley (I haven't been to any of the fancy-pants burger places on the Strip).  A few of the burgers have a cheddar cheese spread that is probably little more than Cheez Whiz, but it makes for a fantastically gooey burger.  The prices are good, the portions are more than generous, and it's a fairly nice environment that is family friendly even though the place has a bar atmosphere.  The pizza looks good, but I haven't tried it yet.  The only negative thing I can say is that the draft beer selection isn't all that great, but whatever.  I don't know if it's worth driving all the way across the city to come here, but it's a terrific place to go for food for people who live in the Henderson area.

Horrible customer service.. I will never be coming back to this bar. I was ignored talked too poorly by the staff. T had flies everywhere and the floors were so sticky don't see how this place could have a good health code at all

Best wings, bar none.  The wings and all of the different sauces make this a place to go.  The great thing about the wings too is that you can get a whole lot of them, like 10lbs of wings, that is just great to order by the pound.  The pizza is not all that great and the sandwiches are dry and not overly appealing but those wings truly are amazing, Have I mentioned that I like the wings yet?  Because I really do.  The rest of the place is hit or miss, the location is also not great, way in the back of a strip mall/shopping center thing.  But once inside you do not really mind the location.
I'm Very Happy with the Roast beef on weck Amazing. Poppers were the best i've ever tried. Thank you for a great lunchtime today
Best pizza  n chicken wings in the world!!!! Love it! I go there all the time!!!! Totally recommend it!!!!
I love this place awesome sandwiches/ wings/ pizza  but SLOWWWWW SERVICE every time I've been in (even when it isn't busy) bummer.

Johnny Mac's is this Henderson "Hole In The Wall" that 100% lived up to its terrific rep tonight! When we arrived the place was packed, but everyone was friendly & we were seated before I knew it. One of the other patrons found out it was our first time @ JM's & suggested we try the "Henderson Special"....which is a large 1-topping pizza & 5lbs of wings! That was a bit much for the 2 of us...but I was happy to discover they had a "small version". We still had 6 pcs of delish pizza & 20 wings to share! Another friend of mine recommended we get our wings "double baked". Sooo good! The sauce & mozzarella on our pizza was incredible. & the bbq & med wing sauce was baked into the wings. So they were completely coated but not soggy. Celery was cold & crisp too, just the way it should be. Service was great. Never ran out of drinks. The wait staff all worked well together & were very attentive. This place looks a lil like a time warp. Neighborhood hangouts the way they used to be. And I mean that as a good thing! :) My son got a kick out of the jerseys & old pics. Our booth was right under this huge buffalo! We will DEFINITELY be back!

It's pretty common knowledge that they have some of the best pizza and wings in town, but they also have the best burgers in Vegas/Henderson.  I had the bar b que bacon Swiss burger today and it was amazing.  You truly can't go wrong with what ever you order here

OK, I heard so many good things about this place so I thought I would give it a try. I went there once brought the kids with me. They had the usual, chicken tenders and fries. They were pretty much the norm that I can find anyplace else. As long as the minions enjoy them, I am ok with it.   I had the linguini with clams, it was ok. Nothing to make my eyes roll in the back of my head. The bread was very good though, I can say that. I could tell it was fresh baked.  The service was ok, I don't remember her name but the waitress was Asian. She gave so so service, nothing more than she needed to.  I decided to take the children there yesterday after the last day of school. It was busy for lunch. The busser sat us pretty quickly and got us drinks. Then we waited, and waited, for about 10 minutes until someone came by. It seemed like they forgot about us or something. The waitress came by and was apologetic and seemed almost overwhelmed because she was so busy.  The Iced tea I ordered tasted funny so I asked if I could get a soda instead. She was so busy, she forgot. I got my soda after a reminder.  For lunch I ordered the two slices of pizza and a soda special and the kids ordered the normal, chicken tenders.  I heard nothing but good things about the pizza and was looking forward to it. When it came out, I was disappointed. First, its cooked in a pan the bottom of the crust was the texture of the pan. Second, it seems like their oven isn't hot enough because the crust wasn't that nice crispy almost burned brown that I love. Overall, the pizza was just meh. Nothing special and nothing deserving of such high praise.   On a positive note, I have had their chicken wings when someone got take out from there and they were pretty tasty  This place is usually very busy and serves typical bar food. It seems like it fits the need of the people in the neighborhood. They seem to have a big local following.  As far as pizza goes, I would go to Sunset Pizza which isn't far from there, they make very good pizza.

First time tourists here from Buffalo, NY.. Had the chicken wing/ pizza combo.  The wings were exactly like the ones from home.. We had BBQ and medium.. Well done with homemade blue cheese.  The wait staff was exceptional with their service and even though it was a local joint, we had a good time and would recommend this place as a low key restaurant for drinks and eats.  The brownie sundae topped it all off.
Wow. What a great jewel in Henderson. Awesome food   We stumbled on this place, heard about it before but never went. I can tell you they have great wings and pizza, will be going here again.
Pizza is pretty good for Vegas ...wings were ok. Good service. Loved this place as it was so close to home. Not bad
Love the new set up!! The bar is awesome with a lot of seats and machines. The food is still just as delicious. Definitely will continue to be regulars!

Been going to this place since I can remember. It's a locals place for sure some of the people have been working there so long they have forgotten how to watch what they say. Other than that the food is good and the service is usually descent.

Drinks are amazing. ....... i had a special order martini and sandra took care of everything.  I will return again and again.  Food is fabulous also pizza, fries, burgers, and wings made our lunch the best lunch ever........

Ordered the Meats pizza delicious & pizza was half off because that's the special on Wednesdays :) fries for the kids as appetizers nothing special about them but service was good & not fast but they were pretty busy so it's understandable & then older man I'm assuming the owner very nice, with that said I'd come back when I'm in town down here :)

Biggest con here is the price. Stick to the specials and you will be happy. The pizzas are good but nothing compared too their wings. You can eat for a couple days Cannot comment on their other food, we haven't tried it

Just happened across this place while visiting Henderson. Loved everything about it. Pasta was really good, atmosphere was nice, but, most of all, everyone who worked there seemed to be having a good time. Highly recommended!
Best food ever, great bartender Luke, and amazing kitchen team. Thanks for the awesome wings and secret pizza!

So, this little strip mall sports bar in the old part of Henderson on Boulder Highway is very interesting. I would say it is in a neighborhood that does not seem to be at the top of its game.    However, this place is packed and with families and kids of all ages.  Unlike any other sports bar!  i have been here three times now and can say, i really enjoy this place.  1. Crowded - Yep, especially on Friday nights and Saturday nights.  We went on a Friday about about 6:15, right AFTER the Happy Hour and so our wait was only 10 minutes.  However, we left at 7:45 pm and the line was out the door and packed.  2. Ambiance - Great sports bar, but a better place to hang with the family. The entire front of the bar is open so it is open air and when the temperature here is great, this is really great.  Lively, open and simply fun.  They should have one of these in the district or somewhere else where there is that community feeling.  3.  Food - Wings, Wings and Pizza.  This is what is great and what else would you want. Sure they have pasta, salads, burgers, and all other bar type food.  the pizza and wings are the key.  We had a half and half traditional pizza with cheese and the other half, the Johnny Mac Special with all that STUFF.  Meat, veggies thick, tasty and juicy.  We also had 3 lbs of wings for the 4 of us and they were cooked just right. We ordered the sauces on the side and next time will have them cooked with the sauce.  A little bit drier when the sauces are on the side and I do like them very moist.  Price - it's a sports bar, it's wings and pizza.  We with drinks and all spent about 20 per person. Not bad at all!  GK says, check this place out, just be careful for those busy times.  Friday and Saturday night, big games...

This place was alright. We came here on a Saturday afternoon. It was semi-full but there was a lot of people waiting on to-go orders. I pictured this place more bar and less restaurant. It was the opposite.  they had several TV's and my pet-peeve. NO VOLUME why even have a tv in the 1st place?  OMG if you've read my reviews you know that is a deal killer for me. and I'll end up somewhere else.  We ordered wings and 2 salads. This must have annoyed this waitress b/c we never saw her again? she spent the ENTIRE time kissing the next table's ass. .and I mean giggling like a teenager at everything this table's patrons had to say, and would by pass us like nothing.  my bf finally said I guess my empty glass is invisible?  I figured it must have been. When we finally did get her attn and flagged her down to get the check - her whole tone changed. I guess the high pitched giggly tone and helpful attitude was reserved only for certain tables and ours wasnt up. Maybe we didnt spend enough?  sorry but I'm only going to order what I'm willing to actually eat.   WINGS: The wings were ok. we ordered HOT and garlic cilantro. The garlic cilantro had ZERO flavor. I was really disappointed b/c I like both A LOT. garlic is up there w/ salt & pepper in my household. The hot good though, but they were very very very VERY greasy. I think i used every napkin in the place. more napkins than BWW or HOOters cant be good in the calorie dept. and the taste wasnt that far above and beyond so IMHO the nxt time I go I'll probably try something else, and maybe get it to go to avoid bad waitressing.

A buddy of mine suggested that we try lunch in Boulder City a place he had heard about from numerous friends and family. Boulder City ??? Great restaurant??? Mutually exclusive. But I'm always looking for excellent hole-in-wall family run places. My GPS indicated that the drive was far less then driving towards the strip on the 215. Before you could say Corned beef and cabbage...the special of the day..we were there .Don't judge this super place from the outside or older shopping center. The menu is without the largest I've seen in a dog's age. If you can't find your favorite you need to see your eye doctor. Be sure to bring your apa..apa..appetite. The corned beef and cabbage was extremely lean with potatoes and carrots.Totally delicious. There are daily specials to please everyone. Half price pizza day...YES. Since a day without dessert is like a day without sunshine...i decided to take the advice of our waiter. Large brownie topped with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce and whipped cream. Without doubt The very best I've ever had.  I think I've found my new favorite place. Btw the service was excellent with a capital E.  Well the diet starts tomorrow Be sure to get on their frequent flyer program...as well. Needless to say I highly recommend Johnny Mac's.
Good food but you need to get there early.  They told us 25 minutes,  waited an hour and we have 2 small kids.

We've been coming to Johnny Mac's ever since we moved to Henderson over 7 years ago.  We ordered Johnny Mac's for Super Bowl 48, and it was then I realized I'd never yelped about Johnny Mac's.  So, I had to remedy that....  Johnny Mac's is what neighborhood bars should be.  It's decently spacious with a good selection of booths, tables, and the bar.  We typically get pizza/wings/chicken fingers to go and usually get sandwiches or some sort of pasta when we eat in.  My favorite sandwich is the Johnny Mac Chicken, which is chicken fingers covered in hot wing sauce, cheese, and baked.  It's large too, you certainly get your money's worth.  The pizza is cheesy and the toppings are plentiful.  It's not a thin crust, but it's certainly not thick.  Somewhere in the middle.  It could have more crunch for me, but I think if they did that it would burn.  So, I'm fine with it.  The wife gets the chicken tenders a lot.  Her favorite sauce is the watermelon BBQ.  This has some actual watermelon in it, which gives the sauce texture and helps it adhere to the chicken better.  Also, the watermelon gives it a sweetness that is different than other sweet BBQ sauces.  The garlic cilantro has a ton of flavor, but it's thinner.  This is another reason we tend to like the watermelon BBQ more.  The wings are as advertised, large, and heavily sauced.  I love their hot sauce, it's a classic wing flavor with enough heat so you know it but not so much that your mouth is scalded and you don't enjoy your meal.  I recommend this joint for eating in and taking out.  It's a great neighborhood bar, and you get good value for your money.

This place is a Henderson institution. It was around long before most of what makes up Henderson today even existed. And after a quarter century, the place is still going strong.   Essentially, Johnny Mac's is a sports bar-type atmosphere that specializes in both Italian and American dishes. There are tons of TV screens showing a plethora of sporting events throughout the establishment. No matter where you are seated, be it a booth, a high-top table, or the bar, you're going to have a good-enough view of the action.   While the place is a bit on the loud side (being a sports bar and all), there are glass dividers between the bar and the normal seating. This is a much-needed convenience I wish other similar establishments had. Ever since the (much needed!) restaurant smoking ban, I have seen more and more people bringing their complete families, including children, in the restaurant. And the employees are friendly and welcoming of them all.   Perhaps the greatest surprise of all is that the food is very good! The ravioli and fettucine I have had here easily rival that of the so-called "higher class" restaurants around town. Really, I haven't had that many items here I didn't like (and the ones I didn't like were a matter of taste, nothing more.)   I have only one complaint with Johnny Mac's - they ONLY serve soup in the fall/winter months. Sometimes, when I come into a restaurant, I am not that hungry, and just want to have a bowl of soup. This is a shame, because the soups they offer in those months are actually quite good. Seriously, how hard is it to serve soup all year round? But that's my ONLY major complaint.   Johnny Mac's has been a part of Henderson for as long as I can remember, and I doubt it is going anywhere anytime soon. And that's all right with me.
