Good food and a fun, welcoming atmosphere make this one of the finest restaurants in "Old Henderson."

Went one day after church to watch some football games. They had plenty of tv's however every tv was on the Bills game ! The salad was terrible limp lettuce 2 olives and a tomatoe . The wings were good and the service was also excellent . A sports bar should appeal to all NFL fans not just the Bills!

I am a fan of Johnny Mac's.  I haven't tried the pizza which everyone raves about, but I can tell you the chicken wings are awesome.  My wife and I ordered three different flavors of them and they were all fantastic.  We also ordered a spaghetti (substituted for ziti) and sausage dish.  It tasted great. Johnny Mac's is now officially my favorite restaurant in Henderson.  I will be stopping by whenever I am in town.

We eat here often and I can't believe I have not written a review until now.  It is a very casual bar/restaurant in a little dive-y strip mall.....but don't let that deter you....the food is great.  They have daily specials so make sure to check those out too.....but we always end up going back for the wings and burgers!!  They are AWESOME!!  The wings are fresh, not frozen and much larger and better than a Buffalo Wild Wings!!  We usually get them double baked because we like the wings to be crispy!!  The sauces are also great....they have the typical mild, medium and hot sauces, but they also have a Watermelon BBQ, Dry Rub Lemon Pepper, Teriyaki, etc. All of the sauces/rubs are great.  My fiance thinks that their burgers are the best and I have to agree that they are very good!!  It is family owned and the service has always been great....one time I wanted something that they didn't have and they actually went to Smith's to get it to make for me!! I can't promise that this will happen again, but it just shows the level of service and commitment to their customers!!

Good pizza, great wings with unique flavor options.  Large portions on all of their food.  Great local business.   **Will note that sometimes the service can be kind of on the slow end, but never to the point where I was frustrated.  I just don't come here when in a rush. :)

Tonight was our second visit. Last time, we tried the wings, which were excellent.. And, the beef sandwich which was one of the evening specials; it was excellent as well.  Tonight, we decided to try the corned beef and cabbage, which is a weekly special on Tuesday nights.. it didn't disappoint. The corned beef was cooked just right, and the large portion was served sliced. The cabbage was cooked with baby carrots (which I don't usually add when cooking cabbage, but it worked), and there were two red potatoes on the plate as well. I believe that for the price, the meal could have included a side salad. Otherwise, it was really good!  We noticed some of the tables around us had wings/pizza combos. We can to go back for a third visit to try the pizza.. It looked awesome!  If you're looking for a friendly place that serves good food.. occasionally has live entertainment and also is very sports oriented, check this place out!

Johnny Macs is located in Henderson, NV. It is a bar and restaurant located in a strip mall with Smith's grocery. The address is 842 S. Boulder Hwy. Henderson NV. It is usually pretty busy and locals frequent this place often. My husband and I love their pizza and wings. His favorite is one of their specialties Watermelon Wings, it sounds weird but we really like them! They do have carryout as well as dine in.  The atmosphere is your classic bar atmosphere, however you will find people of all ages enjoying the food.  Warning: During Football season this place is packed, especially if there is a Bills Game on..

We have been here a couple of times since the remodel.  Prior to that it was takeout.  Tonight we did take out, a chicken parmigiana and a Johnny Mac chicken tender sandwich.  Disappointing!  Tuesday might be a night off for main kitchen staff but there should still have some continuity.  I did not recognize my sandwich with nothing but American cheese and the sauce was supposed to be a medium buffalo sauce.  Not there.  My husband said the best part of his chicken parm was the bread.  I don't know if you check your reviews but you should.  Overall, typically good but your  "shoulder nights" need attention.
Great pizza /wings, cold beer, good music and my new "go to" spot.

This place is Perfect if you want a local place with good pizza and burgers.  Staff was super friendly and the pizza was very good.  Atmosphere is very dive bar esk in the middle of a strip mall.  But it is super nice that place has been non smoking for 20 years.

I heard some amazing things about this place.  A group of us decided to come to Johnny Mac's after helping out another friend move.  We were hungry!  When you drive up, it doesn't look like a big place.  It's located in an awkward strip mall next to Smith's grocery store.  Even when you walk it, the hostess station area is super small.  It didn't help that there were a lot of people waiting.  We were originally told it was going to take 45 minutes for a table.  We waited for a few minutes and then decided to leave.  Great thing was, they caught us on the way out and said they had a table open up.  Great!  Once we turned the corner, I was surprised that the place is a lot bigger than I originally thought. The lighting is low and intimate.  There are a lot of tables and lots of bar space with a plethora of TVs.    Since our party was about 8 folks, we decided to get a couple of the Henderson specials for a little under $40 a special.  This special came with a whole pizza and a tons of chicken wings.  Trust me, it's a lot of food!  Our combined stomachs could not finish this meal.  The chicken was super crispy.  We ordered the mild wings.  It came with ranch that obviously enhanced the flavor of the chicken.  The pizza for me was a little oily.  Still a great meal!  I'm really going to return to this place.  I love the family feel this place offers.  It's a little slice of Italy and really acts as a double ambiance for me.  On one hand, it's great for families and big groups.  On the other hand, it's intimate enough for a nice date with that special someone.  If you're in the area, please come and see what this place is all about.  You'll be just as pleasantly surprised as I was!
I'm from Buffalo and it was my first time coming here. The food was spot on. I had the beef on weck and my fiancé had the pizza special--amazing! We will definitely be back.

Went for lunch during working hours. The food was OK but the service was horrible. Very slow, waitress never returned to check on us and when flagged down for her to bring salad dressing to the table she never brought it. This is definitely not a place to go for a working lunch unless you have unlimited time.

I've been going to JM's for years. My family was originally a big fan of the pizza it's  Fantastic. One of the best places for pizza and it's not a pizza joint. Then we started trying the chicken wings. For a guy who doesn't eat a lot of wings, I think they are really good. Over the last year I've been trying the Beef on Weck, a Beef dip sandwich which is available on their specials menu on weekends only. Boy, that is hands down the best dip sandwich I've ever had. If I were ever to move away from this area this would be one of the places I would miss. And by the way although they've expanded, plan on waiting for a little bit for a table they do get busy. I just wish they had a good place to wait for a table.

Tonight we were first timers in a sea of regulars.  We had a taste for wings and found Johnny Mac's on Yelp. We weren't disappointed.  Our server Gemma was great.  Plenty of additional menu options (most tables ordered pizza) and daily specials.  Busy when we arrived and a line out the door when we left.  All signs of a very popular place that serves great food at reasonable price.  Only negative is, as a Red Sox fan, this place is owned by a huge fan of the Yankees.

AHHHHH-MAZING!! I called in for pick-up and ordered a pasta dish with a pound of wings. The smell on the drive home tempted me so much. The food was great and the wings were perfection. Being from the east coast -- I know wings and these were amazing. Will definitely order from them again and hopefully stop by and hang out inside soon.
I think this is a cool place, I always like hanging here eating pizza :)  Sometimes you appreciate a vibe and this would be a place that has it. I highly recommend Johnny Mac's.

I was visiting from out of town and heard about the watermelon wings, so I decided to try it. We did take out. The wings were okay, pretty chewy, guess I should have ordered double baked. Someone else in my party ordered a BLT. The BLT came with shredded lettuce, which is very odd for that sandwich. But the worst part was is that the menu says "Sandwiches come with chips. Add fries for $2." I did not request fries, in fact fries were not even wanted, and they automatically gave us fries and charged us $2. Didn't notice til we were driving away, not worth driving back for. That is very rude and unacceptable.

Hello and welcome to Johnny mac's. So I am a big lover of Chicken wings and have been told by many people that these are really good. Josie has also heard such things and has been saying for awhile that we should check this joint out. So we did. We finally found a place to park in a very busy area with a smith's anchoring the shopping center. We were half expecting it to be very busy, but was pleasantly surprised that the majority of the busyness was at the to go counter. We were seated right away and our drink order was taken. I will say this is primarily a bar that also has a family section to sit in so do not be shy if wanting to bring the kids. Josie ordered a clam Chowder that was thick and had a good amount of clams in it. Some have just 2 clams and bunch of taters and usually disappoint. This did not. We then ordered the Medium thin crust pepperoni pizza and wings. On the suggestion of the waiter we got the twice baked wings. The wings were good but seemed dry. We ordered again on Super Bowl weekend and got the regular medium wings and were very happy with the signature wings and will from now on order them that way. The pizza was good and crisp with a great crunch. We ordered regular pizza dough for super bowl and prefer the thin crust over traditional. Both tasted great and we would order again. The staff here is great and very informative of the history of the spot. The decor is a great bar vibe and has garage doors where front windows should be.  Thank you for eating at Johnny Mac's. We are planning to return here and try the Fish and Chips since our go to place changed the recipe and is not as good as before. If you are in Henderson on deep Boulder Highway and need a refreshing beer and some good pizza and wings, stop here and experience this spot.   PS......I wanted to add that we just went and had the Fish and Chips and they were amazing. I want to give a great shout out to one of the food runners, Brandon. This guy was running his butt off. I thought he was our waiter. He got our beer, took our order, brought our food and continued to be involved in our meal. Near the end a lady brought us a check and said she would be the cashier. I asked Brandon if he was our waiter or if she was, he stated that she was. We only spoke twice to this lady. Don't remember her name or care to. Brandon got a gracious cash side tip for his outstanding work. I tipped what was customary to the "cashier". That's all she was to us.

Beef on weck! Beef on weck! Did I say BEEF ON WECK! most tender beef on a delicious kaiser roll that has caraway seeds and salt.  Johnny Mac's has mastered this, and their wings!  They have completely renovated the restaurant while keeping the original charm.

Our first time there we ordered the bucket of wings. They were Great going to tell all our friends. After checking the menu we are going back for the fish & chips. The Bar & Grill was clean and the employees were courteous and helpful.  Thank you for a great lunch for our guest.  Dennis Bichsel

we've been coming here for 5 years now & absolutely love it (it's a bit expensive tho so make sure to try one of their daily specials like 1/2 price any pizza on wednesdays) - we come with our kids & sometimes the whole ball team for great pizza & AMAZING wings!  the staff is truly awesome & the drinks are poured stiff! good place to go watch a ball game & enjoy some really great food with the family!!

There was a wait at the door on a Saturday afternoon (a good sign in my book) we got a table after about 5 minutes. Water came out right away and we waited ten minutes to order and ten minutes for food. The chicken salads were okay. Should have gone for the pizza  The house made mozz stick were the bomb.com! The big vin Italian sausage sandwich was good, but the bottom bun was soggy. The onion rings were superb. The kid had a grilled cheese and fries. It is what it is.  In conclusion, get fried food here!

Ordered 2lbs of wings and it was terrible! Got 1 lb lemon pepper and 1 lb of medium. The lemon pepper wings had no flavor and was bland and slightly cooked/dry. It was like eating a piece of fried chicken wing. The wings for medium werent medium. What i got in my box for medium was oil at the bottom and fried dry bland wings on top. Terrible place. I have included pics of what i actually got and is a huge contradiction from other yelpers that ate at johnny mac's. First and last time going to johnny macs.

Came here starving, with the family, around 7pm on a Sunday Night.  Was seated fairly quickly and knew immediately what I wanted to order.  However, 30 minutes later, only the waters came out and I had to get my own place settings!   The person who brought the waters wanted us to wait for our server to put in the order.  We finally put the pizza order in the moment the server arrived, but still noticed that a party twice our size got their food before ours even though they ordered about 10 minutes after I did.  The pizza was just so-so.  Definitely not NY style that I've had in NYC and other authentic pizza places.  Probably should have came here for the wings but the 16 inch for $12 seemed like a good price for a fast meal.  The server was also so-so, after asking for the check, he gave it to us 10 minutes later.  The place wasn't even that busy.  Slow service and mediocre pizza.  If you come, the wings look like the way to go.

I found Johnny Mac's is now participating in the restaurant.com gift certificates. It seemed like the perfect excuse to consume several thousand calories in a sitting when I purchased a $25 gift card for a mere $2 yesterday!  Atmosphere: Dark, dive-esque, while still maintaining a family friendly vibe. It felt nice and homey.. I was digging it.   Service: Attentive and polite, can't complain  Food: So to preface this.. there were only 2 of us, but we needed to get up to $35 to use our $25 gift certificate. Being this is a reasonably priced dive type place, we ended up ordering nearly everything on the menu (or so it felt!).   Wings ($9.95/lb): We ordered ours mild, which I think in Johnny Mac's world means "no sauce" or "flavorless sauce". Despite our ordering mistake, the wings were damn good. I don't even like chicken wings, but these were perfectly fried and awesome. I can't wait to try some with sauce on them next time.   Panini ($5.95 with chips): We tried the philly steak panini. I really enjoyed it. A philly steak panini is a genius idea if you ask me. Fiance complained it needed more cheese, but I thought it was perfect  Pizza ($5.99 for 2 slices with a soda): This was absolutely dripping with grease. My fiance loved it.. it wasn't my favorite, but I'd eat it again! I love pizza, but to me this was about average.   Fries ($2.95): Fried to freaking perfection! These guys know how to work their deep frier.   Homemade garlic bread ($4.25): This was a miss. Bland boring cold bread with a big slice of tomato with melted cheese on top. Ehh.. not so exciting or good. I expected the bread to be toasted at a minimum.  Washed it all down with a couple of 20 oz miller lights ($3.25)  All this was a mere $15 with tax and tip when dining with the gift certificate! I'll definitely be back during football season.

When I first moved to Henderson, I literally picked them out randomly. This was 21 years ago and it was awesome! Since then, I have probably visited Johnny Mac's at least a dozen times.   As it turns out, years later, my nephew (Chris P.) and niece (Katie S.) have worked there for years. Johnny Mac's is a regular hang out for the whole gang.   Thanks for the years of great food and great customer service. I'll be seeing you guys soon!

Came here for St. Pattys day 2014. Had a burger which wasn't great. Tasted like fish. Meat was frozen, not fresh for sure. Also, ordered the burger without some toppings which we still on the burger when it had arrived. The service wasn't on top of their guests and took forever to get anything that we needed.
Every time we visit Vegas, Johnny Mac's is always a must for great pizza and wings. Good for kids too.
Best pizza and wings West of Pittsburgh

Always friendly regular wait staff, they recognize your return and seem to appreciate it. I've never not liked something I ordered.  Wait time is sometimes lengthy but a good environment and usually worth the wait. We'll continue to keep coming back!

Love this local yankee bar. Always good service and foods not bad.  However today i sat and watched a cook(who u can plainly see from the bar) eating and licking his fingers while continuing to work.i almost had to leave but my partner wanted to stay. I'm going to think twice before going back

A little too dark and cramped for my liking.  The whole Italian restaurant and sports bar theme is a little off. The food is really good, but would be better without all the noise of tv's. Italian Food is supposed to be savored, not rushed.

The pizza is great! Although, we arrived and were told they were out of pizza dough. We were told the mixer broke. So I'm assuming no one there knows how to use their hands.....very disappointed. Also, the guy that is SUPPOSED to great you ignored customers and had the personality equivalent to a bag of rocks.  Please teach your kitchen crew how to make dough, it's ridiculous there isn't a back up plan for broken machines. It's true that there are no more chefs, only box openers and microwave techs.

4 stars for food 3 stars for wait time on food   Johnny Mac's is a neighborhood type bar with really good food.  The Caesar salad is delicious, wings always crispy and sauced well, pizza is good, pasta very large portions.  And the servers are very friendly.     Only downfall is bc it's always busy, the wait time on food always takes some time.  I mean, get comfortable it's going to be a while.    But the food is good.  So you won't be disappointed.

Johnny Mac's is Henderson. They take pride in being a culture staple of our city. It's always just a bit murky in there. I'll always order my food( pizza and those yummy double baked waaaangs) and take it home just because I don't want to be there.   I'm aware that they have updated their decor. Maybe the murky feels will have gone away with new wallpaper.

Definitely one of your go to local bars. It's small it's nice and friendly, and they have a jalapeño style pizza. Excellent little place for a guys night and to catch a game or two during football season.

Ordered last night a to go order. I had a Italian sub which in my opinion Subway has them beat.  My husband had the meatball sandwich which he said was very good but the deep fried mushrooms were overcooked.  We usually order wings and pizza and love them.  I guess you should stick to what you know is good.

Johnny, your baked ziti used to be awesome, your wings used to be crispy, your pizzed used to weigh twice as much and was incredible and your beer used to be cold. I have lived down the street for 15 years. My friends and I used to visit weekly for the reasons above.  I have met you a couple of times and you seem like a great guy. I want to provide honest feedback in hopes that we can make your place a favorite again. Sure, the new tv's you installed were a nice touch, but what will bring us back is a renewed focus on the food. The last time I was there, I had to ask Gemma for ice cubes for our draft beers. No excuse. Based on recent reviews, the wings are still not crispy. Folks want crispy wings and cold beer. The baked ziti and other Italian dishes used to be amazing. The pizza used to weigh twice as much (which tells me the quality of the cheese was better). Not sure if this is a chef issue or a focus issue, but we want to come back! Hope you take this review as intended, just honest feedback in hopes that we can help support our local neighborhood business again. No one one wants to go to PT's on Boulder and Horizon. Trust me. Thanks Johnny!

Great wings and beer. Great service! Usually sit at a table or booth. Can call ahead for carry out. Ordered carry out for Super Bowl Sunday. They were very busy but order was ready and service was great even if very busy.

I'll give the wait staff 5+ stars but I have 2 complaints about the restaurant. 1. You're a local joint. Support your local brews! 2. Why do you have a mushroom burger on the menu and put canned mushrooms on it? DISGUSTING! I'll be back for wings and fries.

Best place for wings in Las Vegas.  Having attended college in Buffalo, NY I have a grand affinity to wings and these have been the best so far.  The traditional hot sauces are great, the lemon pepper is fantastic, but their watermelon sauce is something that is special and unique.  You can also get the watermelon sauce on your ribs!  The wing aren't all that is great here.  The burgers are awesome, the ribs are fantastic, the pizza is delicious, and the daily specials make you want to come back every day to try something else. They also feature a Buffalo staple, Beef on Weck, which is awesome.  Come here with the family, come with friends, come on a date.  Enjoy the friendly and welcoming atmosphere and their newly renovated dining room! You won't be disappointed.

The 4 stars is simply for the food. The staff seems to not really care about the customers. If they are busy don't even bother, long waits and poopy staff. The location is a bit stuffy, be careful when walking around their front door. One of their staff members slammed the door open and just about knocked me off the sidewalk, said sorry and kept walking. He was lucky I was not an elderly or they would be facing a lawsuit.

I am so disappointed in Johnny Mac's. I went there on Mothers Day, because I did not want to wait in line anywhere due to it already being 630pm. I called to check on how busy it was and if there was a wait and they told me if i came within 10 mins she would seat my party of 6. We (4 of us) arrived, She seated us within a few mins. A younger gentleman came over and  had taken our drink order.10 minutes Later the waiter comes over to get our drinks and we tell him someone has already taken our request. Hes says ok and walks away. Our drinks come and he tells us the waiter will be with you in a few minutes The last 2 guest of our party arrive, they take their drink order and bring them child size cups!? The waiter hears us laughing about it then we notice the guy comes back and changes them out. Long story short. It took over an hour to receive our food. The waiter being very apologetic about it the whole time. Anyways.. After receiving our Appetizers for a party of 6, We had to ask for plates! Who drops off appetizers without plates?(someone from the kitchen) Then our dinners..One pasta order had SO much water on it, it looked like soup. The waiter apologized commenting the cook is new. Then my sons pasta was a childs size portion! The waiter tells him I know this is a child size portion, again I apologize, like I said the cook is still learning & I'm going to bring you another portion(that never happened) the watered down pasta had to be switched out due to no flavor whatsoever. My husbands spaghetti & meatballs portion was a joke. I asked for ranch repeatedly until I just started to share my daughters ranch than the busperson was asked if he could bring me some. We never recieved our extra napkins we kept asking for. We had to get up& get our own 'to go boxes'.It was not even that busy to even have that long of a wait.The waiter never even came one time to ask how everthing was, we had to flag him or the busperson down everytime we needed something. I am embarrassed I told my kids this place was really good and they'd like it. I have only ordered chicken fingers&pizza from here, I guess that was my mistake #1. Mistake #2 I usually take out. My bill being over 120.00 and yes still leaving a good tip for the busy waiter! I wanted to let you know we were not happy at all. Quality of food was very poor. Customer service was poor. Prices were poor. Don't think I will return here for a 'family dinner' again. Not to mention it was soo cold, we had to go get sweaters out of the car just to quit shivering. We could hear everyone complaining about it being cold and the wait. Not good Johnny Mac's..Not good..

Maybe its just me...I've never had buffalo wings that have ever blown me away.  Most of them are done the same way everywhere.  I honestly can't tell that much of a difference between this place and any Buffalo Wild Wings although the wing meat at Mac's was pretty dry and some of the drumettes barely had any meat on them.  Definitely a one and done place for me.  Not worth the trek from SW Vegas for.
I absolutely love Johnny Macs.  They service is always friendly.  The owner is always around and the food is amazing. Try the meatball and basil pizza!

Went here because of a restaurant.com certificate and loved it.  Everything was really good and tasted like it was homemade. After eating at the pretentous, trendy Little Buddha restaurant at the Palms, this place was a breath of fresh air.  Here's a rundown of some of the food we had:  Salad - tasted fresh, salad dressing was homemade (a vinaigrette) Wings - had a choice of about 8 different sauces, went with the Hot.  Was some of the best wing sauce I have ever tasted.  Wings themselves were cooked fairly well and was crisp.  Was not overauced like at most places and did not overpower anything. Fries - cooked well, tasted like they were double fried so had a nice crisp. Pizza - a little greasy but one of the best pies we've had since we moved here.  Sauce had a nice tang to it.  On top of it, they gave both myself and my husband a free beer.  This is going to be a regular place for us.

Visiting from SoCal and completely blown away with the friendly, but SUPER fast service, delicious food, and great sports bar ambiance (so many TV's and great bar). Will definitely be making a stop here when we decide to come back down.

We are from Minnesota and staying at Lake Las Vegas.  We happened to be in town during the NCAA Frozen Four and our alma mater was playing, North Dakota.  We wanted to find a place to watch the game and assumed hockey was probably not at the top of any list to watch at any local establishment.  We googled and found Johnny Mac's and actually emailed ahead of time to find out if they would play the game if we came.  They got back to us right away and told us to come on down!    We arrived early to get a good table and asked if they could put the game on.  They acknowledged our email and not only turned one TV to the game but three so we could have a birds eye view from every direction.  The owner Johnny came to our table and introduced himself and chatted for quite some time.  Very friendly, from Buffalo, NY so we knew the wings had to be good.  Once the game started he even turned the volume on so we could have the full experience.  Very accomodating.  We literally ate our way through the game.  We had fried zucchini and 2 lbs of wings to start.  Best wings I have ever had!!  We ordered one pound with HOT sauce and one pound mild.  Crispy, delicious and the ranch and bleu cheese were on point.    We followed that up with pizza and fettucine alfredo.  The pizza was awesome!  We ordered the Mac's special and each slice was a meal in itself.  I added chicken and mushrooms to the fettucine alfredo and it was to die for.  The sauce was so good.  Everyone was eating off my plate.    Lastly we of course had to finish with desert.  We had the cookie and ice cream.  They make a from scratch cookie in a mini pie pan and top with ice cream and hot fudge.  Literally comes right from the oven to your table.  We were fighting over the last bite.  The service was impeccable.  They tag team each table so you always get what you need very quickly.  You would ask the person checking on your table for a refill and it would show up moments later from a different server.  It is hard to master this model and they have.    Loved the local crowd.  Everyone that sat around us ended up talking with us and interested in hearing about the game.  We had everyone cheering for North Dakota by the time we left.    Other than being in Philadelphia for the actual game, there would be no where else I would have wanted to watch the game than at Johnny Macs!  We will definitely visit this place everytime we are in town.    Well done Johhny and team!  Great food, great people and a great experience.

I'm here to say that I love Johnny Macs. And I highly recommend eating here as often as you can. The food is great. They are great. And I am always so full I want to vomit. In the best most positive way.
Food is great,  true buffalo,  NY style pizza and wings. Great sports bar as well and if you're from western new York,  this place is home away from home.
We have been here a few times and food is good...pizza, wings and watermelon bbq sauce...a hidden gem...

We stopped in for a bite after a long drive while moving from Oregon to Phoenix. We were super excited to find this little gem where we could order some food and have a drink. We decided to get the Henderson Special which was 5lbs of wings and a Lg pizza. Both were delicious and there was way more then enough food!  The only downside was the service was a little slow, but the place was packed. We will definitely be back on one of our return trips to the area.
Don't judge the place by the area. It is a great place to eat.

The wings were really good! Came for the wings but fell in love with the pizza. They have different combos but it's only a few dollars more for almost double the food so you should get it as long as you don't mind left overs. Good thing is that these were still good the next day.   I preferred the regular buffalo medium but the watermelon bbq was pretty good. Have been here twice as it's a pretty far drive for me but I'm willing to take a side trip if I am in Henderson.
Great local place! Pizza was delicious! Had a brownie dessert that was warm and yummy! No complaints!

Food is a step above most bar food. Service is hit and miss... portions are pretty good.   Pizza and wings are crazy expensive and should only be purchased if they have a special.   Daily specials are good, chicken fingers are awesome... sandwiches are pretty good.  Favorite thing is the giant soda cups! And they usually hook it up with a cup to go with out having to ask. That's why I come back! Love my soda back at work.

As a Buffalonian, I know how wings and pizza should taste. Johnny brought a piece of the famously made Buffalo cuisine to an area desperately in need of a non-chain experience .   If you have the pleasure of coming across this gem in the desert, get their pizza and wings!!!   Wings: Crispy and big, just the way they should , nay,  MUST be prepared.  Pizza: Between New York and Chicago , the crust falls right in the middle...per the Western New York Style. The sauce is a little bit sweet and the cheese is piled high.   Overall: Go visit Johnny, without the burden of going to Buffalo. Our food is amazing, but let's be honest, we'd rather eat it somewhere else. Johnny Mac's in Henderson is the place!

The menu prices and the prices you are actually charged are "subject to change." So beware you might be charged more for your meal without warning like I was. It the food was better or I was at least warned beforehand I might not have minded. Even the specials menu with the current date on them have the wrong price on them. It was a complete rip off and I will not be going back to this establishment.

We always go for the family night special. 5lbs wings,  large salad and large pizza. Service is spotty as you can have more than 1 person waiting on you.  They just added all new and more big screen tvs.
Service is fantastic and the food was good. I really appreciated how cold the beer was and how often the staff checked on me. Great value.

It's definitely time that I update my review, since quite a bit has changed at good ol' Johnny Mac's!  They recently completed a large remodel, which expanded the size of their dining room. It looks really great inside!   We dine here about once a week - the service is always friendly and the food is delicious. On Friday, Saturday and Sundays they feature beef on weck, which I can't resist. We've had so many things on their menu - I love the bacon, mushroom and 3 cheese burger as well as the chicken parm sub. My Mom loves to order the ziti with veggies and my Hubby is obsessed with their version of a chicken finger sub. The chicken wings are big, meaty and juicy.   It's still smoke free and also family friendly. We take our baby there often. It's a Buffalo Bills bar, so during football season they show all of the Bills games and attract a very large crowd.   I am so happy to have Johnny Mac's in the neighborhood and enjoy supporting a small, local and family owned business. Keep up the great work!

Best wing in town!!  Pack your patients it takes a while to get seated.  Once seated you will experience great service and a lot of happy dining. I have never been disappointed here.  Great for take out also.  Wish there was one closer to my house!!

I love this place. Their drink tastes are pretty inconsistent depending on who's making it. I have never not liked the drinks though. They have great pizza, amazing wings, big cheese burgers, and anti-pasta salad to die for.

First time here tonight. When they get busy, the servers seem to get a bit overwhelmed, but it doesn't take away from the food. We tried the burgers and they were awesome. Pictures are below. Prices are average and this is the first place we have been to that will offer onion rings with your burger or sandwhich without an up charge. We will definitely be back for more and highly recommend this to others.

I've eaten here several times over the years, and it has always been a quality meal. It's a nice restaurant/bar with gaming, and smoke free.   My disappointment was I ordered the wings and was so excited to eat them because usually I go with a pasta dish, but the wings were getting rave reviews and I was in the mood for them. I ordered with the watermelon bbq sauce. Oh I'm sorry, we are out. OK, how about the garlic cilantro? Oh sorry, we are out of that as well. I finally just went with plain and ranch dressing, and the wings were nicely done being fried in rice oil, but had no flavoring at all, salt, pepper, or anything.   I'll go back and try again in the future because the watermelon bbq sauce is something I really want to try. But a restaurant should not run out of popular items first thing in the morning mere minutes before a busy lunch hour.

I've come to this family owned restaurant since I was a kid, they have amazing New York style pizza, and delicious desserts that I can never turn down. Most of everything I've gotten off the menu has been good. It's best to get here before 5 or 6, especially on a weekend because it gets busy real fast and you could be waiting for a table for quite awhile. Most of the time our service is great as well, but some times it can be iffy. Just depends on who you get, really. Definitely a relaxed, low atmosphere. On nice evenings they'll open up these garage door type windows, so it's like sitting outside. If you ever want some amazing pizza, this is the place to go.
The food and service were great. The sandwiches and pizza were awesome. Definitely going back for more!  I'll make sure I get pics next time.

This was my 1st visit here @ Johnny Mac's and my neighbor was right on the money. The food here is very good. Wednesday night is half off on the pizza.  When fronds and family come to visit, I 'll bring them here to try the wings,  But for sure we'll be ordering a large pizza.  JP

I honestly would have never even step foot in this restaurant had it not been recommended to me. From the outside it looks like a bleak, typical "hole in the wall" restaurant but inside's a different story!   I learned about Johnny Mac's through my bf on Facebook and became a fan. We found out Wednesday nights are when all pizzas are half off (what a deal!) and WOW...let me tell you...this was the best pizza I have tasted in a long time. I am not a big sauce person but I loved theirs, the mozzarella was so stringy and delicious, the toppings were fresh and the crust was fluffy. Our pizza only came out to be $8!!! Not only that but my little one ordered spaghetti off their kids menu ($3.95) and I think I ended up eating more than she did. It also came with two yummy pieces of garlic bread which I kinda stole too. Oops ;)  It is a sports bar and the fans get loud when games are on...which oddly made it a good choice for me to bring my 4 year old to this restaurant. I wasn't constantly telling her to keep her voice down which was nice. It is a kid friendly establishment and a really nice touch was  the white paper that were on the tables. The hostess gave her a cup of crayons and she went to town coloring the paper!  I look forward to going back to this reaturant. I'm excited to try more of their dishes. I've learned, don't judge a book by it's cover...give Johnny Mac's a try. It will pleasantly surprise you!

One of the only places I like to go! The bar staff, especially Luke, is A++, the wings are the best I've experienced so far (watermelon twice baked with a little suicide sauce), and the other foods are outstanding as well. Also, best Martini I've had in Henderson. Highly recommended!!

We were treated here by relatives who wanted to introduce me and Diane to many of the comfort food treats that abound here in this long-standing pub/sports bar/pizza and chicken wings joint that caters to Buffalo Bills fans.  After about a 15-minute wait for a table because the place was fully packed on a Friday night, I was pleased with most everything I sampled.    Mozzarella Sticks oozing with cheese were very good as a starter, while twice-baked and somewhat moist Buffalo Wings and thin Fried Pickle Spears served with a vibrant dressing for dipping were good.  I just would have preferred thicker spears.  A Small House Salad with fresh greens, tomatoes, celery, carrots, Green Olives, pepperoncini, and homemade croutons topped by a Traditional Italian Dressing was good but not that small.  And I would place a saucy and very sweet Pepperoni Pizza within the upper pantheon of sports bar pizza.  My main dish for the evening was the two-for-one Friday Pasta Special of the Day Spaghetti and House Meatballs mixed with Johnny Mac's very good heat-hot and mellow Signature Tomato Sauce.  The portion was generous, and the meatballs mixed with Italian Parsley were well seasoned, slightly tangy, and delicious.  Two thin slices of Garlic Bread were also very tasty.  I definitely will be back soon to try other featured dishes, especially the Meatloaf served on Mondays, Corned Beef & Cabbage and Reuben Sandwiches served on Tuesdays, Fish & Chips prepared on Fridays, and Roast Beef--sliced beef served on a Kimmelweck Roll--available on Fridays and Saturdays, reportedly a Buffalo, New York hometown favorite.     Service was friendly and efficient.  Offering casual dining amid piped in, pulsing music, this is a loud, active, and fun place to frequent!

Usually I would rate them 4. Service is always crappy but the good is always great. Well tonight we sat for 34 minutes without anyone checking in us. I finally grabbed someone and asked them to check our food and then the server magically appeared and said he hadn't forgot about us. At about 45 minutes they brought some of our food and some wrong food so we walked out.

I've been meaning to write this review for a while now.  I dined here during the last week of December with a restaurants.com gift card.  I got a bad feeling right off the bat when the owner was barked at 3 of his staff members right in front of myself and my kids.  He really didn't even care that we were standing there.   We stood around (with no one in front of us) for 5 minutes with no acknowledgment before the hostess got us to a table.  We sat at our table for about 45 minutes before our waitress even got to us to take our order... yes, you read that right 45 minutes!!  And, this was after having the hostess come by several times to apologize and say she would get the waitress over.  When the waitress finally made it over, she couldn't have cared less.  Seriously, it was like she was irritated she had to take our order.  We were there for over an hour by the time our mediocre pizza made it to our table.  After we finished eating, we again sat for about 20 minutes waiting for our waitress to bring a box and she never came.  So, I got up AGAIN to see if I could bother someone to give us a box so that we could leave since this dinner was now going on over 2 hours.    After all of this, and I was livid at this point, imagine my surprise when I was automatically charged an 18% gratuity... for the worst service I had experienced in a while.  I'm not sure if it's because we used a restaurants.com gift card or what... but if you don't want to accept them, then don't.      *  Horrible service *  Overpriced & mediocre food *  Automatically charged 18% gratuity for a party of 6  *  Owner (or manager, whoever he was) barks at employees in front of guests  Save yourself the stress and eat at Sunset Pizza straight across Boulder Highway.  Their pizza kills Johnny Mac's.

What could possibly be better than pizza and wings to go with football? Nothing if you ask me. Johnny Mac's has been recommended to me by several people but its not really close to my house. I finally decided to drive over there and try them out.   I ordered a large Johnny Mac special and 1 lb of wings. Johnny sells wings by the pound, about 8-10 per order. I like that they make their own dough fresh every day and only buy fresh chicken wings. The order was just finished as I walked in. Johnny's looks like a great local bar with several TVs to watch sports.   First the wings. BEST I have had in the valley. The wings were perfectly cooked and sauced. They were crunchy and not over cooked, just perfect. Served with celery and blue cheese dressing it was a match made in heaven.   The pizza was also very good. I am really picky when it comes to crust and it was just a little too under done and "doughy" for me. The toppings and cheese were great though. They definately are not skimping on the toppings. If it was a little thinner or cooked a little longer it would have been excellent.   Overall Johnny Mac's was definately worth the drive. I will absolutely be returning for more of those wings!
Loved this place!! Food and service are great,  love the remodel,  good atmosphere. I like that its non smoking.  Also, a good place to come for dinner,  watch some sports,  or bring the family.

Hell Yeah!  Finally went in for a burger and so glad I did!  It was huge!  Waitress was friendly and attentive but not always at the table.  I LOVE that the soda cups were huge and didn't constantly need a refill. Great food for an awesome price.

With restaurant.com coupon in hand I came here with friends for some pizza and wings.   I had my heart set on the watermelon sauce. We took a long time looking over the menu deciding what we wanted to order. Once our waitress came she dashed our hopes by not only letting us know they were out of the watermelon sauce, they were also out of chicken breast for the pasta we wanted.  Take two on ordering. We were disappointed but decided on the half rack of ribs, large pizza with meatballs and wings with garlic cilantro, bbq and lemon pepper.   The ribs were ok. The sauce was good but the meat was a little on the dry side. I enjoyed the cole slaw quite a bit. The pizza had good flavor and I enjoyed the meatballs, but the sauce was sweeter than I would have liked and the crust would have been better if it was a little more well done. The wing sauces were tasty, but the wings were a little overcooked for my taste.  Service was spot on. Our server was incredibly pleasant and she was so sweet and attentive.   I don't see myself going out of my way to try this place again, but it's decent if you're in the area. They advertise a pizza and wing buffet for $10 including a drink on Sunday which sounds like a great deal while you're watching the games.

This place is great. They recently remodeled and it is very nicely done. I always order the Henderson Special, which comes with 5 lbs of wings and a large one topping pizza. The wings are the best in town, crispy with great flavor. The pizza is top notch as well. Goes down great with a Labatt Blue. The service is always good and attentive as well. Can't go wrong with coming here.

Best wings and pizza. Ever... I wonder if they can ship us some from Henderson to Houston, Tx.... cool decor, full bar. If you're looking for good food and a good family friendly atmosphere this is the place to be.
